loans.name: Maria Marcela

texts.es: La señora Maria Marcela de 54 años de edad, reside en el barrio Monte Tabor en la capital de  Managua, sus hijos independientes, su negocio es la venta de comida rápida, como enchiladas, tajadas con queso, tacos y otros, con bajos costos, son doce años los que lleva elaborando sus ricos platillos, el cual inicio en sociedad con su hermana con fondo propios, con este préstamo es su tercer ciclo el cual invertirá en comprar granos básicos, plátanos, repollo, queso, maíz y otros productos para mejorar las comida. Dando gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de incrementar su inventarios con productos para que no falte la comida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Marcela is 54 years old and lives in the Monte Tabor neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. All of her children are financially independent. Her business involves selling fast food such as enchiladas, fried plantains with cheese, tacos, and other low cost items. For twelve years, Sra. Maria Marcela has been offering these rich dishes. She started this business with her sister using her own money.

She is requesting her third loan, which she will use to buy basic grains, plantains, cabbage, cheese, corn, and other products used in making her dishes. Sra. Maria Marcela thanks AFODENIC for giving her the opportunity to increase her inventory so that she will never run out of food for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients used in her dishes

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Oscar Antonio G. se dedica en el departamento de Masaya a su actividad de elaboración y venta de sandalias típicas nicaragüenses siendo comercializadas por él mismo en su establecimiento donde muchos clientes llegan a comprarle el producto.

Para llevar a cabo esta actividad, el señor Oscar requiere de la compra de material prima como lo es el cuero, hilo, hule, agujas, hebillas, entre otros. Para esto acude a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de dichos productos y de esta manera continuar comercializándolos en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar Antonio G. works in the Masaya province making and selling typical Nicaraguan sandals. He sells these at his own place of business where many customers go to purchase them. To carry out this activity, Oscar needs to buy raw materials like leather, thread, rubber, needles, and buckles among other things. To do this, he has gone to Ceprodel to request a loan in order to buy these products and in this way continue selling sandals at his place of business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for making footwear

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Olivia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Olivia del Carmen tiene 43 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos de 13 y 15 años de edad, estudiantes, su negocio es una abarrotaría que desde nueve años logro poner en el mercado inicio con golosinas, frutas verduras. Sus planes es poder dejar en buenas condiciones a sus hijos. Con este préstamo comprara granos básicos, productos lácteos, frutas, verduras y poder vender más a si como captar clientes nuevos. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad de prosperar en su inventario como en el volumen de ventas lo cual traerá mejores ventas como ganancias.
texts.en:
Olivia del Carmen is 43 years old and she lives in the Memorial Sandino district of the capital city Managua. She has two children, aged 13 and 15, and they are both attending school. She runs a convenience store that she established nine years ago, starting out selling sweets, fruits and vegetables. Her hope is to provide for her children. With this loan she will purchase basic grains, milk products, fruits, vegetables, as well as introduce new products to attract new clients. She is very grateful to the organization for giving her the opportunity to replenish her inventory. More inventory translates into more sales and better earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, milk products, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Juana Maela

texts.es: Juana Maela Salmerón P. tiene 45 años de edad, su estado civil es casada y tiene 5 hijos  y todos dependen de ella. Juana  desde muy joven ha sido trabajadora  y en el transcurso de su vida ha emprendido muchos negocios de los cuales no todos le fueron viables por lo que decidió empezar  la pulpería, el que hasta hoy sigue siendo su fuente de ingreso, primeramente vendía solamente refrescos, pero al notar que sus ganancias eran buenas decidió vender otros productos. Ella tiene este negocio desde hace 16 años y a lo largo de este ella ha podido contar con Fundación León 2000 el cual le ha proveído de muchos financiamientos, Juana  añora con grandes ansias establecer una distribuidora grande en donde pueda ofrecer otros productos.  Juana requiere y ruega por un préstamo que  le  permita cumplir alguna de sus metas.
texts.en:
Juana Maela S. P. is 45 years old, she is married and she has 5 children, all of whom are still dependent on her. Juana has been a hard worker ever since she was very young and throughout her life she has learned many trades and they have all been very helpful in setting up her convenience store. Her store is her only source of income. At first she only sold soft drinks but soon she saw that she earned a good income, so she decided to sell other products as well. She has been running this business for the past 16 years and throughout she has enjoyed the support of Fundacion Leon 2000 (Kiva Field Partner), and organization that has granted her various loans. Juana Teodora's greatest wish is to establish a wholesale distributor through which she can sell even more products. Juana requires a loan that will permit her to attain her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica del departamento de León, el señor Reymundo E. dedica sus esfuerzos a la actividad agrícola la cual es la siembra de maíz en sus manzanas de tierra donde espera tener una buena cosecha para beneficiar a su familia y a sus hijos que necesitan de su apoyo. 

La razón por la que ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar el crédito para la compra de los insumos agrícolas como lo son crea e insecticidas para aplicarlos a los cultivos y de esta manera obtener una buena cosecha,
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica in the city of Leon, Reymundo E. invests his efforts in his agriculture business. He sows and harvests corn in his fields. He hopes to have a good harvest for the sake of his family and for his children that require his support.

He has appraoched Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan to purchase items he needs for his plantation, such as insecticides, to ensure a good harvest.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase items for his plantation.

loans.name: Miguel Atanacio

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica del departamento de León, el señor Miguel Atanacio R. se dedica a brindar el servicio de audio y grabación para toda ocasión el cual los clientes le solicitan que elabore algunas viñetas o anuncios para estos luego publicarlos en diversos fines ya sea para anuncios en las calles o grabaciones de discos musicales para celebraciones.

La razón por la que acudió a Ceprodel es para solicitar el crédito oportuno para la compra de una computadora ya que la que posee necesita mayores capacidades para así continuar con sus grabaciones y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio y de alta calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica in the city of Leon, Miguel Atanacio Ruis is an audio and recording services provider. He produces vignettes and announcements that will later be used in different venues, such as public announcements to be broadcast in the streets or the production of music CDs for special occasions.

He has approached Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan to purchase a computer. He has seen the need to have one because it will permit him to produce larger quantities of his product, and to keep up the recording services. He wishes to provide a better quality of service to his clients.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a computer.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Pedro H. es originario del municipio de Telica donde se ha destacado en la actividad agropecuaria que es la actividad el cual le proporciona el capital para mantener a su familia que tanto necesita de él.

El motivo por el que acudió a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de cerdos para su respectiva crianza en su establecimiento y luego sacarle el máximo provecho. Es por esto que espera ser beneficiado y así continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Pedro Hernandes is originally from the municipality of Telica. He is an farmer and he uses the earnings from his business to support his family. They very much require his support.

He has approached Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for loan to purchase swine livestock to raise them and later resell them. The funds will be used to this end, so that he will be able to continue to support his family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Francisco Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Ramón M. se dedica a su actividad de agricultura el cuál se ha destacado en la siembra de maíz y frijol en su tierra y siendo esta la actividad que le permite llevar el apoyo económico a su hogar por lo que siempre requiere tener una buena cosecha.

Actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para invertir en la siembra del maíz y del frijol ya que le es de necesidad invertir en ello para así continuar con el mantenimiento de su humilde familia que tanto requiere de él.
texts.en:
Francisco Ramon M. is an agriculturer, sowing and harvesting corn and beans on his land. With this business he is able to financially support his family, and that is why it is so important that he always achieve a good harvest.

He has approached Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan to invest in his corn and bean plantation. He requires to invest so that he will be able to support his humble family that depends so much on him.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his corn and bean plantation.

loans.name: Alicia Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Alicia A. de 34 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casada, con dos hijos de 6 y 14 años de edad, estudiantes de la primaria, su esposo es panificador y la apoya. Su negocio es la decoración de queque que desde hace dos años comenzó por si propia ya que anteriormente trabajaba en pastelería, el cual logro experiencia para instalar su propio negocio el cual puede estar en su casa dar mejor aseo y cuidar mejor de sus hijos ya que le preocupaba por que quedaban solos sus dos pequeños y con tanta delincuencia. Este es su quinto ciclo en Afodenic y ha logrado salir adelante para comprar lo necesario para batir la harina para hacer los pasteles, vende por encargo y tiene en venta. Con este crédito lo quiere para hacer un sumidero y poder estar higiénicamente mejor con su familia lo cual esta contenta por lograr sus objetivo. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible las mejoras para su familia.

loans.use: comprar lo necesario para hacer un sumidero

loans.name: Arnoldo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Arnoldo Antonio Narváez de 57 años de edad, es un hombre que ha logrado cuidar de su familia y de su negocio, su esposa le tiene tres hijos que cursan la primaria dos de ello, y el mas pequeño a un no va a clases, , reside en el barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua, y unos de sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su vivienda, su negocio es la vemta de granos básicos, frutas y verduras entre otros, que junto con su esposa han logrado administrar, las dificultades es que las ventan se ponen bajas y a veces pierde los perecederos, es por eso ha optado ah invertir mas en granos básicos y otros productos para incrementar su inventario y poder seguir con sus ventas. Da las gracias a la institución por apoyar a su negocio como mejorar las condiciones de vida de muchas familias Nicaragüenses.
texts.en:
Arnoldo Antonio N. is 57 years old. He has managed to take care of his family and of his business. His wife has given him three children, all of whom are in primary school. The littlest one does not go to school yet. They live in the region of Hialeah in the capital city of Managua. One of his goals is to improve their home. His business is the sales of basic grains and fruit and vegetables, and he runs it together with his wife. They run into difficulties when sales are down and sometimes their perishable items go to waste. So intead they have opted to invest more funds in basic grains and other products to supplement their inventory and keep their sales up. He is very grateful to the organization for the support given to his business, an initiative that has improved the living condition of many families in Nicaragua.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and other products.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Don Wilfredo de 32 años de edad, es un hombre que desde joven ha trabajado para lograr tener a su familia en una casa propia, su casa es sencilla de piedra y cinz, que poco a poco ha ido haciendo mejoras con los financiamientos que Afodenic ha dado. Reside en el barrio Memorial  en la capital de Managua, el vende útiles escolares como: cuadernos, lápiz, calcomanía, y otros productos escolares, tiene seis años en las ventas, y da gracias a Dios por permitirle la vida y poder tener los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia, anteriormente trabajaba de ebanista en una empresa privada pero se quedo sin empleo lo cual no fue ninguna perdida por que opto por tener su propio negocio que quiere seguir invirtiendo en la compra de pulseras, calcomanía, y variedad de productos escolares que son productos que los estudiante necesitan todo el año. A futuro desea hacer más grande su negocio en el cual pueda poder tener ahorro y poder terminar de hacer toda su casa de concreto.

loans.use: Comprar productos escolares, pulseras, colcomania

loans.name: Angelita

texts.es:
Angelita tiene 47 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y seis D. sus ocho hijos en el distrito pesquero D. San José, ubicado a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace 15 años ella se dedica al procesamiento y venta D. pescado seco – salado, una actividad común en las mujeres D. la zona, ella viaja cuatro veces por semana, durante una hora, hacia el terminal pesquero D. ECOPHINSA, ubicado en el distrito D. Santa Rosa, para comprar rayas (una variedad D. pez cartilaginoso), mantarayas (una variedad D. raya mas granD.) y tollos (una variedad D. pez típico D. la región) que más adelante procesa para luego venderlos en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo).

Su esposo se dedica eventualmente a la pesca, como la mayoria D. pobladores del lugar, pero esta actividad no es lo suficientemente rentable como para cubrir los gastos D. su gran familia, por lo que tiene que esforzarse casi a diario para mantener su negocio.

Ella desea seguir sacando adelante a los cuatro hijos que aún tiene a su cargo, D. 16, 10, 6 y 3 años D. edad, y asegurarles un futuro mejor brindándoles una educación D. calidad;  por lo que está solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra D. más pescado que procesar y vender para así seguir apoyando a la economía D. su hogar.

Angelita ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nosotros en tres oportunidades demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que es considerada como una cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Angelita is 47 years old, she is married and lives together with her husband and with six of her eight children in the fishing district of San Jose, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past 15 years she dedicated her time to processing and selling dried and salted fish. It is a common occupation for the women of the region. She makes a one-hour trip four times a week to the fish markets of Ecophinsa, located in the Santa Rosa district, to purchase rays (a species of cartilaginous fish), mantarays (a variety of rays, larger in size) and Spot fin sharks (a fish commonly found in the region). Later she resells them in the markets of Moshoqueque (a wholesale market in the city of Chiclayo).

Her husband is a fisherman, as most of the rest of the population in the region, but fishing is just not profitable enough to cover his family's expenses. He puts an extra effort almost every day to keep up his business.

Her hope is to be able to support her children that are still in her care. They are aged 16, 10, 6 and 3. She wants to proviD. them with a better future through a quality education. She is requesting a loan of 1500 nuevos soles that will will invest in the purchase of more fish to process and resell, so that she may continue to contribute to the family's finances.

Angelita has had three loans in the past and she has been reponsible with her payments. She is considered an excellent client.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is a member of The Dawn village bank. She is 45 years-old, lives with her partner, and has three sons. Her youngest son (16) lives with her and is studying at public school.

Maura was orphaned by her father and was only able to complete fifth grade because she didn’t have the money to continue. She began to work selling sweets in the streets. At 16, she got engaged and decided to become a seamstress. She designed and sewed various bag designs to her neighbors. Next she began to design and sew different articles of clothing to sell.

Since Maura has joined FINCA her life has totally changed. Her economic status has improved and she is thankful for the loans. She encourages her neighbors by telling them that they can progress and improve.

Maura needs a loan of 3000 PEN to buy various rolls of fabric for making clothes and sheets. Her dream is to have a large business that sells sheets.

loans.use: Buy rolls of fabric to make clothes and sheets.

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
María  Natividad V. es socia del Banco Comunal Si Se Puede vive en el  sector de Yanuncay en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 51 años edad, es divorciada hace 20 años, tiene 2 hijas de 29 y 20 años de edad, la primera ya es casada y vive independiente de ella, la segunda de sus hijas está estudiando en la universidad de Cuenca la carrera de Derecho, ella vive en una casa arrendada y su hija soltera es la que le hace compañía.

Es empleada privada (camarera) en el Hotel Tomebamba, mientras que los sábados, domingos y feriados trabaja vendiendo salchipapas y hotdogs en su domicilio, y cuando la venta esta buena da gracias a Dios porque con eso se ayuda para el pago de el agua y la luz.

Este es su cuarto préstamo, pertenece a un gran grupo ya que entre todas son muy solidarias y se llevan muy bien, el préstamo que adquirió lo va a invertir en la compra de mesas, sillas y materia prima para  en ampliar su negocio

Los sueños que tiene es ver a su hija ser una profesional y que tenga un postgrado en otro país.
texts.en:
Maria Natividad V. is a member of the Community Bank "Si Se Puede". She lives in the Yanuncay district of the city of Cuenca. She is 51 years old and she is divorced now for 20 years. She has 2 children, 29 and 20 years old. The eldest is already married and is independent, but the youngest is attending the university in Cuenca, studing law. She lives in a rented house with her youngest daughter.

She is on the cleaning staff of Hotel Tomembaba, but on Saturdays, Sundays and on holidays she sells salchipapas (a regional specialty of sausages and potatoes) as well as hotdogs from her home. And when she has had good sales she thanks God because this is how she is able to pay for the water and hydro bills.

This is her fourth loan. She is part of a large group that help each other and do very well in consequence. The loan will be destined to invest in the purchase of tables and chairs, as well as ingredients to expand her business.

Her dreams are to see her daughter have a career and that she do graduate work in another country.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business purchasing ingredients, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Magali

texts.en:
Magali is a member of The Dawn village bank. She is 37 years-old, lives with her partner, and has three children who are 14, 12, and 3. They are studying in the public school.

Magali started an education but didn’t get to apply it because she got married and left on a trip to Argentina, but things didn’t work out and she had to return. She constantly suffered beatings by her husband to the point where she had to go to the hospital.

This is when she decided to start selling clothes. She bought three shirts for little girls and two pairs of pants. She succeeded in selling them and then bought more. Since then, Magali has sold clothes for a living. Twelve years have passed, and she now has a partner that respects and supports her.

Since joining FINCA, Magali has learned to value herself as a woman and to work toward her dreams. Magali needs a loan of 1400 PEN to buy discounted clothes and footwear. Her dream is to see her daughters grow up and become professionals.

loans.use: To buy discounted clothes and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Elza Patricia

texts.es:
Elza Patricia Guamán C. es socia del Banco Comunal Si Se Puede, vive en el Barrio Parco loma vía a Santa Rosa que está ubicado  a 45 minutos a las afueras de Cuenca.
Tiene 31 años de edad, es casada hace algunos años y mantienen una buena relación conyugal, su esposo es chofer de transporte público, actualmente  viven en la casa de sus familiares, tienen un hijo de 5 años de edad que ya  va a la escuela Juan Estihellr en Quinta Chica.

Elza es vendedora de productos de belleza para la mujer como perfumes, labiales,  joyas, etc. También realiza  trabajos en todo tipo de costuras en el tiempo que tiene disponible, el horario se fija ella ya que es independiente. Las ventajas de su trabajo son los premios que le otorgan por las ventas de los productos, las desventajas encontrarse con clientes morosos y largas horas de caminata por que visita a sus clientas  casa por casa.

Este es  su primer crédito y se lleva muy bien con las socias, María Zhañay la ánimo para que se integrara a este gran grupo de mujeres muy alegres y solidarias, con el préstamo solicitado ella va a incrementar su negocio comprando más productos para tener un buen surtido de perfumería para sus clientas.

Su meta es llegar a tener su propio auto  para su comodidad y un mejor servicio a sus clientas.
texts.en:
Elza Patricia Guamán C. is a member of the communal bank Si Se Puede. She lives in the neighbourhood of Parco loma near Santa Rosa which is located 45 minutes from the outskirts of Cuenca. She is 31 years old and has been married for a few years. She has a good relationship with her husband who is a public transport driver. They currently live in the house of her relatives. They have a 5 year old son who already goes to the Juan Estihellr school in Quinta Chica. Elza sells beauty products for women such as perfumes, lipsticks, jewellery, etc. She also does all types of sewing work in her free time; she sets her own schedule since she works independently. The advantages of her job are the rewards that she gains through the sale of her products. The disadvantages are late-paying clients and long hours spent walking, since she visits her customers house by house. This is her first loan and she gets along very well with the other members. María Zhañay encouraged her to become part of this great group of very happy and supportive women. With the loan that she is applying for she will increase her business by purchasing more products so she can have a good selection of perfumery for her customers. Her goal is to eventually have her own car for her convenience and to offer a better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more beauty products and increase stock for her customers

loans.name: Yolanda Ynes

texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of The Dawn village bank. 
She is 42 years-old, married, and has 5 children who are 19, 17, 16, 14, and 13. All her kids go to public school. 
Yolanda decided to work out of economic necessity. She works out of her house selling hot dogs, hamburgers, chicken sandwiches, and hot drinks. She is out every night selling her food at her door.   
Since joining FINCA, Yolanda’s life has changed. She has more customers in her business and she feels useful because she is able to help with the bills of the house. 
Yolanda needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy sausage, potatoes, flour, a jar of mayonnaise, and mustard. Her dream is that her children become professionals and to buy a car so that her children can use it for work.

loans.use: buy sausage, potatoes, flour, a jar of mayonnaise, and mustard

loans.name: Sara Isabel

texts.en:
Sara is a member of The Dawn village bank. She is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children who are 5 and 2 years-old. Her 5-year-old goes to public school and Sara still looks after her other son.

Sara studied in school until she was 15 but then left because she didn’t like it. She worked for five years in different shops selling different things. She became pregnant and stopped working but a year ago she decided to begin selling clothes to her neighbors. She has ten consistent clients.

Since joining FINCA Perú, Sara says that FINCA has been a great help by making it possible to invest in clothes to buy and teaching her how to save. Sara needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy clothes in bulk to sell. Her dream is to have a place in the market where she can sell clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk to sell

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en:
Luciano is a member of The Dawn village bank. He is 54 years old, separated, and has two children who are 26 and 25 years old. The youngest is married and the eldest lives with him.

Luciano came from the province of Chiclayo to Lima at the age of 16 and worked for a travel agency for twelve years handling documents. Unfortunately, he lost his job when the business went bankrupt. However, with his savings he was able to buy a used car. He works everyday as a taxi driver.

The loans he has received since joining FINCA have been a great help with the unexpected costs of his taxi. Luciano needs a loan of 1,200 soles for the maintenance of his taxi and to fix the taxi’s transmission. Luciano’s dream is to live in Chiclayo in a couple of years.

loans.use: To use for the maintenance of his taxi and to fix it’s transmission

loans.name: Tautala

texts.en: Tautala H. (0) is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Puipaa. She is married and has five school-aged children. Tautala owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 420 WST a month. In 2006, Tautala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Tautala is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Sefulu

texts.en: Sefulu L. (0) is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Matautu-Lefaga. She is married and has three school-aged children. Sefulu owns and operates a business running a bakery, baking and selling a variety of confectionaries such cookies and cakes in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 350 WST a month. Sefulu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase baking equipment. Sefulu is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Masi

texts.en:
Masi S. (0) is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Maagiagi-K2. She is married and has five adult children.

Masi owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 800 WST a month.

In 2005, Masi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Masi is now requesting a new loan of 2,000 WST which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve her business. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Sinuutupu has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 350 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Sinuutupu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Sinuutupu has successfully repaid a previous loan of no WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  Sinuutupu is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Sinuutupu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

loans.name: Rodelma

texts.en: Rodelma D. is from the village of Puntod Upper, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Rodelma owns and operates a sari-sari or general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Rodelma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rodelma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz tiene 52 años D. edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos y vive junto a su esposo y el último D. sus hijos, que es soltero, en el distrito D. Santa Rosa, ubicado a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Ella confecciona tejidos y bordados D. manera artesanal desD. que tenía 15 años D. edad, actualmente tiene en su casa un pequeño taller donD. elabora diversos pedidos hechos por sus clientes; confeccionar un mantel le toma una semana aproximadamente ya que el proceso D. tejido y bordado es muy minuciososo y laborioso.

Su esposo, al igual que la mayoría D. hombres del lugar, se dedica eventualmente a la pesca artesanal y con lo que ambos perciben tratan D. sacar adelante la economía del hogar, por lo que Cruz continuamente tiene que esforzarse para elaborar más tejidos y así seguir apoyando al sustento diario D. su familia.

Su más granD. anhelo es trabajar D. forma independiente y distribuir sus tejidos en las principales tiendas artesanales D. la región, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito D. 1800 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra D. hilos y telas para empezar a trabajar D. manera independiente y así lograr su sueño.

Cruz es muy conocida en la zona por la calidad y la responsabilidad con la que elabora sus tejidos, sus clientes están contentos con los trabajos que ella realiza y constantemente la animan a seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Cruz is 52 years old, she’s married, has 5 children, and lives with her husband and the youngest of their children, who is not yet married. They live in the Santa Rosa district, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been making weavings and embroideries by hand since she was 15 years old. She now has a small workshop in her house where she makes a variety of items requested by her clients. It takes approximately a week to make a shawl because the process of weaving and embroidering is very detailed-oriented and hard work. Her husband, like most of the men in the area, works seasonally in artisanal fishing. With what they both earn they try to make things work economically for their family. Cruz continually works at making more weavings so that she can continue to sustain her family. Her greatest wish is to work independently and to distribute her weavings in the main crafts stores in the region. This is why she is requesting her first loan, 1,800.00 PEN, from our institution. She plans to use it to buy threads and fabrics so she can start to work independently and achieve her dream. Cruz is well-known in the area for the quality and responsibility with which she makes her weavings. Her clients are happy with the pieces she makes and they constantly encourage to keep going forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy threads and fabric to make embroideries

loans.name: Talalelei

texts.en: Talalelei L. (0) is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Taufusi. She is married and has eight school-aged children. Talalelei owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling baked goods in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 450 WST a month. Talalelei joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,200 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Talalelei is now requesting a new loan of 1,950 WST which will again be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be her 3rd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos, estudio educación secundaria completa, vive   el  Centro poblado de Jamachi Yancaro.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace mas de 3 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para comprar ganado menor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, este monto será invertido en la compra de  ganado menor ovinos, La Sra. Julia  luego los vende en las ferias de la zona que son una ves por semana.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando, para poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Community Bank "Jesus de Nazareth", located in the Centro Poblado Lopez in the city of Ilave, in the province of Collao, Puno. She is 29 years old and she is married, and is mother of 3 children. She completed high school. She lives in Centro Poblado Jamachi in Yancaro. She is with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for more than 3 years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/.300 nuevos soles and she used the funds as working capital to purchase livestock. She currently requires a loan in the amount of S/.2000 nuevos soles, funds will be invest in the purchase of pigs. Julia later resells them in the country fairs of the region that are held once every week. Her hope is to keep working so that she will be able to send her children to school. She enjoys savings and attending the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La señora Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y madre de 8 hijos, estudio educación primaria completa, vive   el  Centro poblado de Choro Quequera.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace mas de 5 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para ganado menor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va adquirir ganado ovinos, para engorde y luego los lleva a la feria dominical de Ilave, la sra. Felicitas también se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías como prendas de vestir chompas, chalecos, etc.

Su deseo es poder educar a sus hijos y que todos salgan profesionales.

A ella le gustan las reuniones.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Community Bank "Jesus de Nazareth", located in the Centro Poblado Lopez in the city of Ilave, in the province of Collao, Puno. She is 46 years old, she is married and is the mother of 8 children. She completed primary school. She lives in the region of Centro Poblado Choro Quequera. She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for more than 5 years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/.300 nuevos soles, funds that were used as working capital and invested in the purchase of livestock. She is requesting a new loan in the amount of S/.700 nuevos soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of pigs, for fattening. She will later take the livestock to the sunday country fair in Ilave. Felicitas also fashions clothing, such as sweaters, vests etc. Her hopes are to be able to send her kids to school and to see them all have a career. She enjoys attending the regular meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 4 hijos, ella es iletrada, vive   el  Centro poblado de López.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace mas de 3 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra de abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo será invertido en la compra de ganado menor esta actividad la realiza en las comunidades cercanas, luego los vende en las ferias de la zona que se realizan una ves por semana.
Andrea también se ayuda con trabajos de artesanía como chompas para pedidos.

Su deseo es poder compra ganado mayor y venderlo a los mayoristas.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Andrea is a member of the Communal Bank “Jesús de Nazareth”, which is located in the town of López in the Llave district, El Collao province, department of Puno. She is 32 years old, lives with a partner and is the mother of four children. She is illiterate and lives in the town of López. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement (micro-finance institution) for more than three years. Her first loan of 300 nuevos soles was used as capital to purchase grocery supplies. She is now requesting an additional loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of small livestock. She will sell them in the nearby communities’ weekly town fairs. Andrea also makes crafts, such as sweaters, and sells them by order. Her greatest wish is to buy large livestock and sell it to the wholesalers. She enjoys the loan meetings and workshops.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small livestock, cattle, pigs, etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús D. Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado D. López del distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. el Collao, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 6 hijos  (3 dependen D. ella), ella estudio primaria completa, vive   el  la parcialidad D. Janahui.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace mas D. 4 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para compra D. ganado menor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma D. S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo ella lo va a utilizar en la compra D. ganado menor ovino, chanchos, ella los compra en las ferias D. ganado, luego D. mejorarlos los venD. en las mismas ferias que son una vez por semana.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovinos y chanchos.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señora Martina es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 66 años de edad, es casada y madre de 8 hijos  (3 dependen de ella), ella es iletrada, y  vive   en el centro poblado de López.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. hace 4 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para compra de ganado menor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo ella lo va a utilizar en la compra de ovejas para engorde, para venderlo en las ferias semanales la sra. Se ayuda trabajando en sus chacha.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando, para ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martina is a member of the Communal Bank “Jesús de Nazareth”, which is located in the town of López in the Llave district, El Collao province, department of Puno. She is 66 years old, married and the mother of eight children (three depend on her). She is illiterate and lives in the town of López. She has worked with the Manuela R. Movement (micro-finance institution) for more than four years. Her first loan of 300 nuevos soles was used as capital to purchase small livestock. She is now requesting an additional loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of sheep to be sold in the weekly town fairs. Martina works in her small farm. Her greatest wish is to continue working to support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep.

loans.name: Bertha Martha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 21 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos, ella estudio secundaria incompleta (3ro grado), y  vive   en la parcialidad de Jamachi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para compra de ovejas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 2300.00 nuevos soles, este monto ella lo va a utilizar en la compra de ovejas y algunos chanchos, para luego venderlos en las ferias de ganado que son los domingos en Ilave.

Su deseo es darles una profesión a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovejas y chanchos.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 5 hijos, ella estudio primaria completa, y  vive  en el  centro poblado de López.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para compra ganado ovino.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo ella lo va a utilizar en la compra de ovejas, para mejorarlas y venderlas en las ferias de ganado que son los domingos en Ilave, Pilcuyo, la Sra. Rosa también vende productos de la región.

Su deseo es poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovejas.

loans.name: Magali

texts.es:
La señora Magali es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y sin hijos,  estudio secundaria completa, y  vive  en el  centro poblado de López.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para compra de abarrotes y golosinas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo ella lo va a utilizar en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, fideos, golosinas, galletas, etc. Para su tienda.

Su deseo es poder surtir mejor su tienda.

A ella le gustan  las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, fideos, golosinas, galletas, etc.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos, ella estudio secundaria completa, y  vive  en la parcialidad de Cutipa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace  1 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para comprar ovejas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo ella lo va a utilizar en la compra de ovejas, Lidia los vende en las ferias semanales en Pilcuyo e Ilave los domingos, también se ayuda con sus chacras.

Su deseo es poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan  las reuniones y los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovejas.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús D. Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado D. López del distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. el Collao, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 45 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 5 hijos, ella estudio secundaria incompleta (2do grado), y  vive  en la parcialidad D. Janchallani.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para comprar ovejas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma D. S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, este dinero ella lo invertirá en la compra D. cabezas D. ovino, para engorD. y venta en  feria zonales.

Su deseo es poder educar darles una profesión a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan  los ahorros
texts.en:
Catalina is a member of the Jesús D. Nazareth Community Bank, which is located in the López town center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 45, married, and has five children. She went to high school for two years. She lives in the Janchallani region. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. She used her first loan for 300 PEN to buy sheep. She currently needs an additional loan. That is why she is asking for 600 PEN to buy sheep to fatten and sell at the regional fairs. Her wish is to be able educate her children so that they have a profession. She likes the savings (in her Community Bank).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Ko

texts.en:
C., 50, sells various kinds of vegetables in Psa Leur Market and earns approximately $3 US profit a day. She is married to Mr. Kluy, age 60, who shares responsibility for the family and cultivates a rice crop. In addition, he also rents a neighbor's farming machine which he uses to plow the villager's farmland for a fee. C.'s husband appears in the photo. This older couple has been blessed with five children: four are single and the other is married. Two of the children are employed.

C. has been building a new small house for months, but the construction is postponed frequently due to lack of money. Therefore, she requested a loan of $500 US in order to finish building her house.

loans.use: To finish building her house

loans.name: Ruth Pastora

texts.es:
La señora Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el  Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y madre de un niño, estudio primaria completa, y  vive  en la comunidad de Churo Maquera.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 1 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para comprar abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, este dinero ella lo invertirá en la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideos, aceite, galletas, etc. Para abastecer su pequeña tienda.

Su deseo es poder educar a su hijo.

A ella le gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the Jesús de Nazareth Community Bank, which is located in the López town center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 24, single, and has one child. She has an elementary school education. She lives in the Churo Maquera community. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost one year. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought groceries. She currently needs an additional loan. That is why she is asking for 700 PEN to buy sugar, rice, noodles, oil, and crackers, etc. to stock her small store. Her wish is to be able to give her son an education. She likes the savings and the meetings (of her Community Bank).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, noodles, oil, and crackers, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
“No one can survive in the midst of crisis without sacrificing,” says Elizabeth T., a loving housewife married to Ronald T.. They live in a rural area, in Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. They belong to a poor family, but they have strong faith and determination to become successful some day through their patience and sacrifices. Furthermore, they want their children to be successful in the future; hence, they are doing their best to earn an income to satisfy their needs and support the education of their children.

As a source of income, Elizabeth's husband cultivates their parcel of land by planting rice and vegetables while Elizabeth is engaged in selling fruits and vegetables during the day, and, during the night, she sells balut (chicken embryo) which is a delicious snack. She uses her small capital to acquire products which she sells retail in their barangay (village).

When Elizabeth was informed of the programs and services of the lending institution, she joined the programs and applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP as capital for the improvement of her business. She hopes that, with her patience and sacrifices and with financial assistance, she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for a fruit, vegetable and "balut" business

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza D. is known by her nickname, “ Iza”, in their barangay (village): Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She finished secondary education and is happily married to Mr. Alfonso D.. They are blessed with three children. Despite the hardships and difficulties of life, they still aim to be successful some day since they believed that, “Nothing is impossible to the person who [has] the strong faith and determination to achieve.” They help each other to earn and save for their survival and for the education of their children.

As a source of income, Mr. D. cultivates their farm by planting rice and vegetables, while Iza engages in the buying and selling of vegetables in their barangay. She uses her small working capital to acquire vegetables from Nueva Vizcaya Agricultural Terminal (NVAT) which she sells retail. With her patience and sacrifices, she is able to earn a net income of 700 PHP per week, which they use to satisfy their needs and to support the education of their three children.

Iza aims to improve her business, but she has inadequate capital. When one of the lending institutions offered their programs in their barangay, Iza voluntarily joined and applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to have additional capital to acquire more fruits and vegetables to sell in their barangay. She is so thankful to join the organization, because it gives her the opportunity to strengthen her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for vegetable business

loans.name: Rosevelita

texts.en:
Rosevelita S. is a responsible mother and lives in Brgy, Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. Because of financial difficulties, she could not pursue college-level studies. She used to help her parents to earn a living. She is married to Mr. Danilo S. and they are blessed with six children. Despite hardship and difficulties in life, they strive hard to earn a living to finance their children’s schooling.

Her husband, a retired army man, cultivates rice and vegetables on their parcel of land, while Rosevelita sells different snacks such as Banana cue, Camote cue and native cakes. From Monday to Friday, she sells snacks inside the school campus and, on Saturdays, she offers home delivery of her products. By her patience and efforts, she earns PHP 300 per day, and she utilizes this income to meet her family’s basic needs and to pay her children’s tuition fees and allowances. She wants to improve her business so that she can earn a higher income. One of her neighbors informed her about microfinance program of ASKI, and she immediately joined the program to borrow additional capital. She is asking a loan of PHP 5,000 to improve her business.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos, ella estudio secundaria incompleta (3er grado), y  vive  en la comunidad de Jamachi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra de productos de la región.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, este dinero ella lo invertirá en la compra de ovejas para mejorarlos y  venderlos en la feria de Ilave.

Su deseo es darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovejas.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel Z. is engaged in rice retailing business for years now. She purchases sacks of rice and retails it per kilogram in her village. Maricel would like to avail a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase stocks of rice. She desires her inventory be full so that her earning never stops. Her daily income from her business is indispensable to her family because their daily food allowances come from the business. Maricel wishes for her family’s good health and dreams of uplifting their lifestyle someday.

Maricel, 28, is married to Benito Z., who works as a wood carver in their village. While both of them work hard everyday, she hopes that her children will also complete their studies someday. Bren Justine, their eldest son, is now six years old and is studying in Grade I in primary school. Their youngest is only one-month old. She hopes that her business grows so that she can meet the growing needs of her children. She also dreams of sending them to school and college someday so that they can uplift themselves from the poor living condition.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Rencelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Rencelyn T. is commonly called by her neighbors as “Lhen.” She is a resident of Brgy, Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She was in second year of college when she got married to Mr. Lucky Leo T.. They are blessed with three children, two of whom are in elementary school. She wants them to finish their studies and earn degrees.
Due to lack of job opportunities, her husband uses their tricycle to earn income, while Lhen sells boiled and fried peanuts around the school campus and at the public market of Brgy. By virtues of patience and sacrifice, she earns a net income of PHP 500 per week. She uses this income to meet her family’s daily needs and finance her children’s education. She wants to improve her business but has inadequate capital. Fortunately, when she came to know about the benefits and incentives of the programs and services offered by one of the lending organisations in her barangay, she immediately that organization. With support from this organization, she has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 as additional capital for improving her business.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en:
“Love your work to make you succeed” is the quotation shared by Salvador N. Jr. who resides in Barangay Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Due to financial difficulties, he was not able to pursue his studies in college. He helps his parents earn a living for their survival.

Salvador is married to Jocelyne N. and they are blessed with two children who are presently studying in the secondary and elementary levels of education. Salvador and his wife help each other to earn an income to support the studies of their children because they want them to become successful in the future.

The couple cultivates their parcel of farmland twice a year by planting rice and vegetable crops. Since they have inadequate capital, Salvador is requesting additional farming capital of PHP 18,000 from Kiva lenders for the maintenance of their crop production. He wishes to generate support from the lenders and promises to pay back the loan at the right time.

Salvador works hard on the farm and he is patiently supporting his family through his farming. He also hopes to give his family a progressive standard of living in the future.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
47- years old Emily P. is a farmer and a pig grower. She has one child who are 21 years old now. Her husband left her and so she just focus all her attention to her business and to her  only child. She started farming since 1986 and she wanted to make it grow to be able to withstanf the bigger challenge currently she faces.

Receiving a loan of Php 8,000 is truly worthwhile especially that she doesn't have something to use to support her business. She really needs additional capital to buy fertilizers for her farm and piglets for a piggery business.

Believing always on her dreams, she is never lose hope to the power of hard work and prayer. She thanks CEVI for partnering her through the years. She likes it services because it has the lowest interest rate of 2% a month that is very easy and affordable to repay.

loans.use: fertilizers and piglets

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is now fifty-six years old and is married to Dionicio M., who runs their furniture business. They are presently residing in the village of Allinguigan 3rd, Ilagan, Isabela and they are blessed with four children who are in their adult ages. 

	Flora has a passenger tricycle which is being operated by her son. Aside from this, she is also indulged in livestock business where she manages a poultry business. She has been in this kind of business for already two years and she would like to further expand her poultry business to be more profitable. Flora is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP6, 000 to have funds in purchasing needed materials to be replaced in her passenger tricycle. She also plans to purchase another batch of chicks for her poultry to maintain her livestock business. She hopes to avail the loan because it is of big help to their family.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos, estudio primaria completa, y  vive  en el Centro poblado de Titiri, Comunidad de Choco Quillicami.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 ciclos, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra de ovinos.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, este monto ella lo invertirá en la compra de ovejas para venderlas  en las ferias de Ilave Pilcuyo y López.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan  y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Jesús de Nazareth Community Bank, which is located in the López town center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 40, married, and has two children. She has an elementary school education. She lives in the Titiri town center in the Choco Quillicami community. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two loan cycles. With her first loan for 500 PEN she bought sheep. She currently needs an additional loan. That is why she is asking for 1,000 PEN to buy sheep to sell at the Ilave, Pilcuyo, and López fairs. Her wish is to continue working. She likes the meetings (of her Community Bank).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
“Work hard in order to survive” a word of encouragement of Melinda P. who is a loving housewife of Floramante P.. They live in a rural community of Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. They are gifted with six children, three of them are now in college while the others are in secondary and elementary education.
	In this regard, they are striving hard to earn an income to support the education of their children. Farming is the primary source of their income; they plant rice and vegetables for two cropping. Furthermore, Melinda is engage in selling snacks in their barangay to earn additional income. When she discovered that it is beneficial to them, she aims to continue and improve this business. Since she has small capital, she joined in one of the Microfinance organization and applied a loan amounting to P 5,000 to be used in the improvement of her business. She hopes that she can able to improve her business through the help of the Microfinance Organization.

loans.use: additional business capital

loans.name: Dalisay

texts.en: Managing a general store is the primary activity of Dalisay I.. According to her, she wanted to buy additional stocks of merchandise so that she could minimize her expense in going to and from the market. She observes that her merchandises can be sold immediately that’s why she is asking additional capital amounting to PHP5, 000 for her to be able to purchase additional merchandise. Dalisay and Roberto are blessed with six children but three of them are already married. Her three children left are still single: Precy-25 years old, high school graduate; Cory-23 years old and Jonie-21 years old and he is also a high school graduate.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Yaqueline

texts.es:
La señora Yaqueline es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y sin hijos, ella estudio secundaria completa, y  vive  en el Centro poblado de López.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. hace 6 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra de ovinos.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, este monto ella lo invertirá en la compra de ovejas para engorde y venderlos en las ferias semanales de su zona.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y comprarse mas ganado.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos
texts.en:
Mrs. Jaqueline is a member of the “Jesus of Nazareth” Community Bank located in the population center of López, in the Llave District, in the province of Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 26 years old. She is single and doesn’t have any children. She has completed her secondary studies and lives in the population center of López. She has worked with the Manuela R. Movement for six months. Her first loan was for 500.00 new soles. This amount she used to invest in the purchase of sheep. Actually, she is asking for an additional loan. For this loan she is asking for the sum of 800.00 new soles. This amount she will use to invest in the purchase of sheep so that she can fatten them up and sell them at the weekly fairs in her zone. Her desire is to continue working and buy more livestock. She appreciates the loan facility.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock (sheep)

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: The smiling person shown in the picture is Mrs. Seng C., a 51-year-old married mother of a school-aged child. She lives with other family members in her own small family home in Kompong Tom Province. Seng owns a piece of land  inherited from her grandparents upon which she and her husband grow a variety of crops such as cabbages, cucumbers, and rice, which she will sell to buyers every month when the plants mature.  Seng is now requesting a loan to purchase sacks of fertilizer for her land.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena C. makes a living by vending dried fish in their village. She has been involved in this kind of business for many years already. It already serves as her main source of income which supplements the daily needs of her four children. Elena is purchasing her dried fish in the market and patiently carrying her basket around their village just to dispose all her products. 

	Elena is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP6, 000 to be used as her additional revolving capital for her business. She plans to buy more quantities of dried fish with different kinds to retail in their village. With her plans, she is anticipating more profits which will be sufficient for their family needs.

	Elena is already thirty-two years old and is married to Heraldo C. who works in their own farm. They are residing in the village of Allinguigan, Ilagan, Isabela.  They are blessed with four children and three of them are already studying.

loans.use: additional business capital

loans.name: Tarcila

texts.en:
Tarcilla T., a 39-year-old businesswoman from the village of Alinguigan, Ilagan, Isabela, is happily married to Ernesto, who is already 40. They are blessed with four children, three of whom are studying. Tarcilla prays that her three children will finish their studies with the help of the business the couple operates. Their eldest child is already helping them in their business after graduating from elementary school.

Tarcilla and her husband run a furniture business in their village. They join hands in making their business successful and they are trying to double their time in producing more furniture for greater profitability. They want to give their children good futures and as much as possible earn their degrees in college someday.

Tarcilla is requesting a loan of PHP7,000 to further expand their business. Her plans include purchasing woods that will be needed in their business, and she anticipates being more profitable after receiving working capital from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ciria Maruja

texts.es:
La señora Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente y con un hijito, ella estudio secundaria incompleta (3er grado), y  vive  en el Centro poblado de Churo López.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. hace 6 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra de ovinos.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, este monto  ella lo invertirá en la compra de ovejas Maruja vende las ovejas luego de mejorarlos a mas precio en las ferias de Ilave.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y le gustaría comprar ganado mayor.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino.

loans.name: Byron

texts.en:
At present, many people are struggling from financial difficulties due to our uncontrollable economic crisis. In this regard, everyone must be wise enough to use their time and money wisely in order to survive, said by Byron S. of Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. He is using his time to earn income and save for his future especially when he got married. He finished a vocational course particularly driving mechanics. 
	He uses his tricycle to earn income which they used to acquire their daily needs and to save for his future. Because of his interest to earn more income, he joined in one of the Microfinance organization and applied a loan amounting to P 5,000 as additional capital in the maintenance of his tricycle. He is so happy in joining the said organization when he discovered that it has more benefits and have low interest. He believes that he can able to earn more income with the help of the said organization.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena M. strongly believes that a man of perseverance never tires and will someday be rewarded with success. This served as a word of encouragement she used to share with others and to her children also. Magdalena is a resident of Barangay Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Esmenio M. and they are blessed with three children. With their patience, two of their children are already finished their college education and hoping that they could apply for a job immediately. 
	The common source of their living in the village is through farming and hog-raising. They help each other to cultivate their farm by planting rice and corn for every two cropping seasons. During this coming second cropping, Magdalena wanted to apply for a loan amounting to PHP36, 000 to be used in acquiring the needed agricultural supplies for the maintenance of their crop production. She hopes that Kiva lenders will lend her the amount of which is a big help in the growth of their farming. It will also enable her to become more determined to succeed in the business because she believes there is Kiva that anticipates for her business to grow.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
To make a living, Tomasa raises pigs for sale. She has been in this business for over 10 years now and earns approximately 400 PHP per day as her net income from this activity.

Tomasa is 49 years old and she lives in the town of Calamagui, San Pablo, Isabela. She is married and has 4 children. They are Jeanette, 27, a college graduate; Atelano, 23 years old, a graduate of an automotive course; Jerick, 14 years old, a second year high school student, and Jack Alison, 12 years old, a Grade VI pupil.

Tomasa is asking for financial assistance to improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which she will use to invest in her business.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Lualhati

texts.en:
Lualhati F., a resident of Barangay Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya, is married to Samuel and they are gifted with two children, Daryll and April. The eldest is now in his third year of college while the youngest is now in her third year of high school. Lualhati, who was unable to pursue a college education due to limited finances, wants them to become successful through their studies.

Despite the hardships of life, the couple helps each other in cultivating their rice field by planting rice and vegetables for two sets of crops a year. Lualhati is now requesting a loan of PHP23,000 for the maintenance of their crops to ensure a good yield this coming harvest season. She wanted to join in the microfinance program of Kiva because she believes that it will be of great assistance to them considering the low interest rates that they offer.

loans.use: Additional capital for crop maintenance

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
At the age of 30, Julieta Z. is still single. She lives with her parents in the peaceful village of Alinguigan, Ilagan, Isabela. Julieta dreams of having her own stable business someday. She doesn’t aspire to be married anymore; what she wants now is to have a source of income to provide for herself and to help her parents with their daily expenditures.

Julieta joined ASKI to acquire working capital in order to have a small business. She has used a loan to purchase Avon, MSE, Natasha products, and so on. She has paid off her previous loan already and now she is on her second loan with ASKI.

Julieta is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP from Kiva lenders, and she is hoping that she will again be entrusted with these funds. The loan will be used to expand her direct selling business. She plans to buy more Avon, MSE, Natasha and Boardwalk products so she will have actual products, in addition to the brochures she brings her customers. Julieta has already proven that having actual products with her is an advantage, which is the reason why she’d like to avail of a loan.

loans.use: To expand a direct selling business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y con 4 hijos, ella estudio primaria completa, y  vive  en el Centro poblado de Churo Maquera.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra de ovinos.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, este capital  ella lo invertirá en la compra de ganado ovino, su negocio es una vez por semana en las ferias de los domingos en Ilave.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros ya las reuniones.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elsa is a member of the Communal Bank “Jesús de Nazareth”, which is located in the town of López in the Llave district, El Collao province, department of Puno.
