She is 32 years old, married with four children. She has elementary school education and lives in the town of Churo Maquera. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement (micro-finance institution) for six months. Her first loan of 300 nuevos soles was used as capital to purchase sheep. She is now requesting an additional loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of sheep to be sold in the Sunday weekly town fair in Llave. Her greatest wish is to continue working. She enjoys the savings and the loan meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
“Ask the Lord to bless your plans and you will be successful in carrying them out,” says David C., the loving husband of Sanie. They live harmoniously with their three children at Barangay Sto. Domingo Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Their children have already finished their studies in college and are now employed. They believe that this is the fruit of their strong faith and determination to move forward.

In addition to being a farmer, David is also a Pastor in their church. Furthermore, he cultivates their farm by planting rice and some vegetables while his wife manages their piggery business. He is now requesting a loan of PHP15,000 as additional farming capital to develop his rice farming business which provides his family with an adequate supply of food and assists them in maintaining their pig-raising business.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y madre de 8 hijos, ella estudio primaria incompleta (transición), y  vive  en la parcialidad de Jamachi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra de ovinos.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra de ovejas, que  luego de mejorarlos los vende  en las ferias semanales de su zona.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Jesús de Nazareth Community Bank, which is located in the López town center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 48, married, and has eight children. She did not complete elementary school (transition). She lives in the Jamachi region. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six months. With her first loan for 500 PEN she bought sheep. She currently needs a new loan. That is why she is asking for 600 PEN to buy sheep. After fattening them she will sell them in the weekly regional fairs. Her wish is to continue working. She likes the simplicity of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda A., from the village of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del sur, is a 50-year-old married mother of three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a food market whose main source of income comes from selling vegetables in the local community. Florenda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Florenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase additional vegetables to sell, she is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. This will be her second loan GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosal

texts.en:
Rosal B. is 46 years old and married to Mansuelo who is a local farmer in their village. They are blessed with 6 children. Rosemarie, 29, a college graduate; Phylyne, 27, also a college graduate; Marnelie, 25, college gradute also; Maryrose, 20, presently a 4th year college student taking up Nursing course, Marynelle, 20, 4th year college student taking up Nursing course also, Jesmin, 16, 1st year college student taking up Architecture.

Lanie owns and manages a general store business in their village. She also maintains a hog raising business aside from her store to have additional source of income. Through her income, Rosal is able to assist her husband in providing their family needs. In order to improve her store and hog raising business
Rosal wants to request a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to have additional capital. She hopes that her loan will be approved to be able to achieve her desires in life.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur E. is a hardworking father and he lives with his family in a rural place located at Barangay Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. His wife is Jane and they are blessed with three children namely: Catherine, Arjay and Lory.

Being responsible parents, and through their sacrifices in tilling their rice field to provide their children’s educational needs, two of their children are already finished a nursing course and they are presently working abroad, while at the moment, their youngest child is still studying in college, taking Information Technology.

Arthur is the one who cultivates their farm lot for a crop twice a year. He plants rice and vegetables while his wife manages a piggery. Because according to him, they don’t have enough capital to acquire the needed agricultural supplies for their rice field and feeds needed for their hog raising business, he wants to request a loan of PHP 15,000 as additional business capital for their agriculture business, both farming and pig raising.

Arthur is hoping that, someday, his youngest child will also finish college like their two eldest children because, according to him, it is the only wealth that he is able to give them.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Lotis

texts.en:
Lotis D. C. has been helping her husband in their furniture making business. She does canvassing in different villages while her husband is busy in producing different kinds of furniture. Lotis also aims to be progressive in their business. She is now asking for financial support to further expand their business. They need to purchase more woods so that they could produce more products. She hopes that her PHP 6, 000 loans will be provided because it can make their business grow further. 

Lotis already has three children. She is married to Gabriel D. C. and they are peacefully residing at the village of Alinguigan 3rd, Ilagan, Isabela. Their eldest child, Diland is now ten years old and is studying in primary school, same with their second child who is Francies who is six years old. Their youngest child is just four years old.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is married to Resty B., and they live harmoniously in the rural community of Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. They are gifted with a daughter named Shirley, who is already 19 years old and taking up a nursing course. They want her to become successful in her chosen career so that she has a bright future.

Despite the difficulties of life, Julie and her husband help each other to earn income to be able to provide their important necessities.

Due to lack of job opportunities, her husband chose to work abroad with a four-year contract while Julie is the one who manages their agriculture business. She also operates a general store where she is able to earn a daily income. She used to hire farm laborers to till their farm lot so as to maintain it so that it will not be abandoned.

Because of her lack of capital, Julie wants to borrow PHP 41,000 from Kiva lenders to be able to develop both her rice farm and her store. During harvest season, she is able to earn an average income of PHP 15,000 that is utilized for the tuition fees of her child and sometimes to sustain her store.

Julie hopes that she can produce more crops and expand her store someday.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is raising ducks within the village of Nagbukel San Isidro. She is thankful because she is able to raise all her ducks. According to her, she needs to ask financial assistance to ASKI so that she could sustain the needs of her ducks. Her husband Arturo is engaged in their rice-farming. The couple is blessed with three children: Jayson-21 years old, 1st year college student; Joe-20 years old, high school student and Jefferson-16 years old, 4th year high school student. Josephine’s goal is to send her children in higher level of education that’s why she is doing everything to supply the needs of her family. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP5, 000. She hopes that she could avail the loan amount that she is requesting to be able to increase her profit and at the same time to provide the needs of her family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn T., 33, and her husband, Mr. Vit Chea, 38, live in a small village along National Road Number Two about 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1990 and have four children; one daughter who has full-time employment, and three sons, one of them attends school and the other two are still young. 

Thorn has been a chef for three months; she cooks for a place that produces Khmer noodles. Previously, she used to operate a grocery store. Mr. Vit Chea also has been working for the same place with his wife for two months. He used to be a soldier as well. He now wants to supplement his work with another business selling sawdust; it will be better for him to generate extra income for supporting his family. 

Hence, Thorn is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer for her husband to carry sawdust to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a trailer for carrying sawdust to sell.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 38 years old and married. She was born in the province of Cagayan. She has 3 children: Carmina, 13 years old a sophomore high school student, Willie Jr., 10 years old a grade 5 pupil, Ella Mae, 8 years old, she is a grade 2 pupil, all of  them are enrolled in a public school in their village.

She juggles housework with running a small grocery store in her own house together with her husband in order to provide a good education for their children. She hopes that her children will become professionals someday.

Filomena is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to buy some non perishable goods and additional items to sell in order to gain her income and to improve her business. She promises to pay back the loan as scheduled and she is entirely grateful for the opportunity that KIVA lenders are providing for her in order to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
It is in a rural community of Sto.Domingo Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya where Corazon D. and her husband raised their family. They are blessed with three children and they are Edizon, Evelyn and Neressa. The couple is able to provide their three children with good education except with her eldest child who only ended up in high school level. The two youngest are presently working abroad now as care givers while the eldest is a jeepney driver in their Barangay.
The primary source of their income is thru farming. Twice a year, Corazon and her husband are helping each other in tilling their rice field and to further maintain their farming, she wanted to borrow a loan amounting to PHP18, 000 to purchased fertilizers and pesticides. She believes that those farm inputs would make their crops more productive leading to a higher harvest. She hopes to acquire the amount through the support of Kiva lenders. She also believes that by patience and hard work, their business undertakings will someday become successful.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia M. is commonly called as “ Celia” in Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She was born on September 30, 1963 and finished only elementary education. She did not pursue her studies because her parents can not afford to finance her schooling. She helps her parents to earn a living until she decided to marry Rudy M. and they are blessed with six children. Due to hardship and difficulties of life, most of their children only finished secondary education and the two youngest are presently studying in elementary and secondary education.
	The primary source of their living is through farming, they till their land for two cropping a year by planting rice and vegetables. Celia wants to engage in business particularly in selling smoked fish in their barangay but she has no enough capital. Fortunately, when one of the Microfinance Organization offers their programs and services to their barangay, she decided to join to be able to borrow additional capital. She applied a loan amounting to P 5,000 to have additional capital to acquire more smoked fish to sell in their barangay. She is so thankful with the financial support of the said organization because she can able to start her own business.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia O. is commonly called “Ermie” in her village Barangay Sto. Domingo Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She finished high school and no longer pursues her college studies due to financial difficulty. She works hard and helps her parents earn a living. She is now married to Manuel O. but unfortunately, they are not blessed with a child. Although, they maintain a harmonious relationship with each other.
	They help each other to satisfy their immediate needs, and eventually save for the future. Farming is their primary source of income. They cultivate their farm land twice a year by planting rice and some vegetables, which are the common products produced in their place. Aside from that, Ermie is engaged in selling vegetables and snacks in their village in order to generate additional daily income. Wanting to sustain the needs of their palay (rice), Ermie wanted to borrow from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP11,000 to finance their farming needs. She hopes that somehow their rice crops will turn productive in order to increase her daily income to survive the hardship of life.

loans.use: additional capital for farming needs

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Mrs. Imelda P. is the loving housewife of Mr. Darwin P.. They live harmoniously in a rural community of Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. Due to the hardships and difficulties of life, they are striving hard to earn a living for their survival and to give their child a better future.
	Imelda is engaged in selling vegetables at Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. With her small capital, she acquires her products from Nueva Vizcaya Agricultural Termina (NVAT), which she sells in Barangay.  As a fruit of her efforts and sacrifices, she is able to earn a net income of PHP 500 per day which she adds to her husband’s income to satisfy their daily basic needs, and to support the education of their child. She aims to strengthen her business, but she does not have adequate capital. When her neighbor informed her of the programs and services of the Microfinance organization, she voluntarily joined to borrow additional business capital. She is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional capital to acquire more fruits and vegetables to sell. She is so thankful in joining the organization because it helps her to improve their status of living.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Herwin

texts.en:
“Make a plan and work hard to become successful in life,” shared Herwin E., who is a farmer living at Barangay Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. He is married to Angela E. and they are blessed with three children. Due to the economic crisis, the family strives hard to earn a living for their survival and to support the studies of their children. They want them to be alleviated from poverty.

Herwin drives his family to become diligent and determined in their endeavors by giving importance to whatever livelihood they have in their village. His wife sells vegetables and fruit in their village to help him generate income.

Herwin needs additional capital for their farm maintenance to buy needed farm inputs for their main livelihood project which is farming and to provide his wife with enough capital for her rice-retailing business in their village. He requests additional capital of PHP 14,000.

They hope that they will be able to produce a bigger harvest and earn a higher income through this financial support.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline A. is a retailer of cell-phone loads. She is grateful because she is married to Albert A. who is a very loving husband to her. The couple always helps each other to be able to improve their business and at present it’s doing well.

As days passed by, Evangeline observed that she needs to have an additional amount of cell-phone loads so that she could also generate a bigger income to provide the needs of her family. She would like to borrow additional capital of PHP 5,000 for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that she could obtain the loan to be able to attain her goals in life.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 25 years old and he is living in the town of Calamagui, San Pablo, Isabela. He is married to Mary Ann, 27, who is a plain housekeeper in their village. The couple is blessed with only one child. Noel is a good provider to his family, despite being a young father.

Noel is a tricycle driver in their village, he wakes up early in the morning to set up his work. In this kind of activity he earns an income of PHP 300 per day. He plans to venture into another business, which is hog-raising, to further support his family’s basic needs.

Noel wants to improve his business in order to support his child with his school needs and to enable him to finish a degree course someday. Noel is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 as additional capital to further expand his business.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Ma. Theressa

texts.en:
“Be patient and be industrious to have a brighter future” is the statement shared by Ma.Theresa B. who is commonly called “Thess” at Barangay Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is a loving housewife of Clarito B., a Barangay Councilor in their village. They are blessed with three female children namely Clarissa, Shiella, and Carlota. Their eldest child is already graduated from college while the two younger children are currently in tertiary and secondary level of education. They are striving hard to earn income and to satisfy their daily needs especially in providing the education of their two children. 
	Her husband cultivates their farm twice a year. They used to plant rice and vegetables while Theresa is engage in selling cook viand and snacks in their Barangay. She wanted to borrow additional farming and vending capital from Kiva lenders that is amounting to PHP14, 000. Their PHP15, 000 gross incomes in farming every harvest season usually is not enough because of the big interests they put to their debts. Theresa is very thankful that with Kiva loans, her family and other farmers in their village will somehow lessen their credits, debts from traders. She is just hoping that through wise farming management and patience, they will able to uplift their living condition.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris C. owns and manages her general store in front of their house. It has been her main source of income since her children were still young. For her, she’s already contented with her business. She just wanted to be more productive and be able to have more commodities to sell. She aspires to improve her business to be more profitable for the benefits of her children. 

	Maricris is asking for financial support to further expand her business. She would like to obtain an amount of PHP5, 000 to be used in purchasing additional commodities to be displayed in her general store. She believes that by having complete groceries to retail, her business will be more competent because customers usually go to store to look for their needs and she wants to meet it. 

	Maricris is a native of Allinguigan, Ilagan,, Isabela. She is happily married to Apolonio C. and they are blessed with six children whom three are presently studying. Macrisis will do her best to provide the needs of her children. She hopes someday that they will finish their studies to able obtain a good future.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas M. is engaged in retailing cooked foods in their village. She aspires to further expand her business to be profitable. She plans to retail more cooked foods so that she’ll also generate more income everyday and provide sufficient needs for her children.

Felicitas needs additional capital amounting to Php 6,000 to improve her business and to have a fund for purchasing needed ingredients for her cooked foods. She hopes to be given the chance to expand and grow her business with the loan she is proposing.

Felicitas is already 51 years old and has three children. She is married to Ernesto M. and they are presently residing at Alinguigan, Ilagan, Isabela. Two of her children are currently studying: one is in college and the other one is in high school. She hopes to keep them in school until they finish their courses in college.

Felicitas is glad that her husband is patiently working on their own farm to sustain the educational needs of their children.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Diomedes

texts.en: Diomedes is 47 years old and he is managing a repair shop, he is skillful in repairing some damage appliances such as electric fan, washing machine, iron and other appliances. He wants to double his income in order to provide the needs of his family. He is hoping that he could avail the loan that he is requesting which is amounting to PHP5, 000.00. The said amount will serve as a big help to have additional business capital to be able to increase his income. He works hard to be able to provide the needs of his family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Normalita

texts.en: Normalita is 46 years old and married to Renato. She is a dealer of cosmetics products and RTW’s. She would like to purchase all the orders to her of her customers but her capital is insufficient that’s why she is requesting additional capital amounting to PHP5, 000 for the improvement of her business. Normalita has been blessed with three children: Reynor-25 years old and he is a college graduate; Alvin-23 years old, also a college graduate and Venus-16 years old and presently in 1st year college. She wanted that her youngest daughter could also finish her college studies and that’s the reason why she is asking financial support from KIVA, for her to continue supporting her daughter in her studies.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 41 years old and is a resident of Barangay Calamagui, San Pablo, Isabela. He is married to Elizabeth, 35 years old, who has been working as a domestic helper, abroad, for almost three years now. They are blessed with three children: Jonaliza, 14, a freshman high school student, Jolisa, 11, a grade four pupil, and Joberet, 9, a grade three pupil, all of whom are enrolled in a public school in their village.

Joseph operates and manages his rice-mill business in their village. He currently makes an income of Php 500 per day to provide the basic needs of his family and he is also engaged in hog-raising as an additional source of income.

Joseph’s business is good, so he is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 for general maintenance of his rice-mill business to be able to continue working. The loan will help improved their family finances.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 31 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y es madre de 04 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en la comunidad de V. Chile.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado mayor, para engorde.

Su mayor sueño es poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Virginia belongs to the Communal Bank “Manuela de Hoy II” which is located in the community of Camicachi in the Llave district, El Collao province, department of Puno. She is 31 years old, lives with her partner and is the mother of four children. She has elementary school education and lives in the community of V. Chile. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement (micro-finance institution) for two years. Her first loan of 500 nuevos soles was used as capital to purchase small livestock. She is now requesting an additional loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of large livestock. Her greatest wish is to give her children an education. She enjoys the convenience of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase large livestock.

loans.name: Julie Grace

texts.en:
It is in Barangay Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya where Julie Grace and Rolando M. raise their family. They belong to a poor family but they have the strong determination to become successful someday. They are gifted with three children whom they called Arjay, Allan and Arvin who are now in elementary education. Julie and Rolando want them to finish their studies so that they will have a brighter future.

Despite the hardship and difficulties that life may bring, Julie Grace and Rolando are striving hard to earn a living and to finance the schooling of their children. The common source of their income is through farming: they till their parcel of land twice a year by planting rice and some vegetables. Furthermore, Rolando works as a carpenter while Julie Grace engages in selling barbecued food in front of their house to earn additional income. As a fruit of her patience and sacrifices, she is able to gain a net income of PHP 700 per week which they utilize to satisfy their needs and to support the schooling of their children.

Julie Grace aims to improve her business but she hasn’t enough capital. Fortunately, when one of the lending institutions offered their programs and services in their Barangay, Julie Grace decided to join purposely to borrow additional capital. She applied for PHP 5,000 to be used in the improvement of her business. She is so happy in joining the organization because it helps her to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en: Choeun A. is a young married womA. age 22, and she and her husband have one lovely young child. Choeun A. has owned a medium size farmland on which she plants rice. As another source of family income comes from her husband's running a taxi service; he pick up tourists who want to visit Angkor Wat Temple, or anywhere else in town. Choeun A.'s husband has always hired a neighbor's taxi at highest price to operate the good service he provides. He right now wants to own a taxi but he has not yet money to buy it since his family financial is just enough for his family's daily needs. He has told his wife about this and they have decided to seek a loA. from HKL for capital to buy a motor taxi(Tuk Tuk). With the owning taxi will help them to cut down the cost of hiring. Note: Choeun A.'s husband is pictured.

loans.use: To buy a motor taxi

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopha U., is a widow with only one daughter. She lives in a small village along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sopha has been selling vegetables for five years. She hopes to support her daughter’s further education and has a good job.

Sopha is applying for her first loan of $500 in order to purchase a computer and pay school fees for her daughter who is attending university.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and pay school fees for her daughter who attends university

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina M. is engage in vending of goods such as under wears, blouses, t-shirts, pants and other goods for both men and women. She has been five years engage in the business. She desires her business to become more profitable for her to provide the needs of her two children who are both studying. Martina is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP7, 000 to have additional capital in purchasing new batch of goods to continuously have profit.

	Martina indulged herself in retailing business because she wanted to help her husband in making profit for their family. Her husband is a wood carver. She is glad because he is also working hard just to support their children’s studies. Their eldest is already studying in college and she needs a lot of money for her tuition fees and allowance. Their youngest child is now in her third year high school and soon she will be entering college. Martina wants to be prepared always for the education of their children and she is dreaming for them to finish their studies. She hopes that all their aspirations will soon be attained with their diligence in working.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes M. is already forty-six years old and is married to Agapito M., a forty-eight years old farmer. They have four siblings whom three are still studying. Their eldest is George, twenty-three years old, who already earned his degree in college and now working as a Philippine National Police. Next to him is Jay-jay, nineteen years old, he is now a graduating graduating college student. Followed him is Jerome, sixteen years old, who just started attending college this school year. Mercedes is praying that all her children will finish their studies someday through their business which they are trying to improve more. 

	Mercedes, along with her husband runs a furniture business. They are helping each other in making and disposing their products. Their children have now growing needs which is the reason why they need to double their effort in producing more products. The couple needs additional revolving capital to finance the needs of their business. She is requesting to borrow a loan of PHP7, 000. They need to purchase more woods so that they will be able to produce more furniture in a short period of time. She hopes that her proposal will be approved because it will be of great help to the success of their business which could also assists the educational needs of their children.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen M. is engaged in retailing junk products in her village. She has been in this kind of business for many years now; thus her living condition has been elevated. Wanting to sustain the progressiveness of her business, Aileen would like to obtain a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to have additional capital in purchasing used cans, bottles, plastic wares, steels, and other materials that she could sell in the junk shop.

Aileen has never felt ashamed of her business. For her, what matters is that she makes a living with this kind of business, and it is a very profitable source of income. She doesn’t mind what others may say, as long as she is happy with what she does, she will keep doing her job.

Aileen is 28 years old and from the village of Allinguigan, Ilagan, Isabela. She is not yet married and has no children. She joins in this organization not just because of the capital that she needs for her business but also because she wanted to grow as a Christian through the Bible sharing that is being implemented by this organization.

loans.use: To purchase used cans, bottles, plastic wares, steels, and other materials that she could sell in the junk shop

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Don’t lose hope is the outlook in life of Nathaniel E.. He is commonly called “Nathan” in their village at Barangay Sto. Domingo Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. After finishing his vocational course, he married Shirley De Leon and they are blessed with two children. They wanted their children to be successful in their chosen field someday.
	Despite the economic crisis that is happening in the country, this couple is doing their best to uplift their poor living situation. They help each other to earn income for their survival and for the future of their children. They cultivate their farm for two cropping seasons by planting rice and vegetables. Furthermore, Nathaniel uses his tricycle to earn additional income daily for their immediate necessities. Due to financial difficulty, Nathan wanted to request for financial assistance from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 to purchase the needed agricultural supplies for the maintenance of their crops in the field. He hopes that his harvest will become plenty and earn a higher income with the continuous support of KIVA.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
La señora Maximiliana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 47 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 05 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en la parcialidad de Lupaza Maya Pamaya.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 meses,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado mayor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado vacuno para engorde, para luego venderlos en la feria de la zona.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Maximiliana belongs to the Manuela de Hoy II Community Bank, which is located in the Camicachi community, Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 47, married, and has five children. She has a third grade education. She lives in the Lupaza Maya Pamaya region. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four months. With her initial loan for 500 PEN she bought large livestock. She currently needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy cattle to fatten. She will then sell them at the regional fair. Her wish is to keep working. She likes the savings and the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura E. is from the village of Gingoog, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Laura is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Laura owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Laura has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Laura joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laura has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Laura is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Laura from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Set

texts.en:
Mr. Set S., 65 (shown in the picture), and his wife, Mrs. Kong Sem, 64, live in a small village along national road number 2, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, have been married since 1963, and have 7 children: 2 sons and 5 daughters. Unfortunately, 4 of them have died. The remaining children are married, and 2 live in separate houses.

Set and his wife have been growing rice for 40 years. He is now requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide for his farming business.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide for growing rice

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
La señora Anastasia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 47 años de edad, estado civil conviviente es madre de 08 hijos (6 a su cargo) y tiene estudios de primaria incompleta (2do grado), vive en la Ilave Jr. San Martín S/n..

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 2 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de diversos tipos de cereales. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de cereales como quinua, cebada, trigo, etc. El mismo que lo vende en la feria semanal de Ilave.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas
texts.en:
Mrs. Anastasia belongs to the Communal Bank “Manuela de Hoy II”, which is located in the community of Camicachi in the Llave district, El Collao province, department of Puno. She is 47 years old, lives with her partner and is the mother of eight children (six depend on her). She has some elementary school education (2nd grade) and lives in the town of Llave Jr., San Martín. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement (micro-finance institution) for almost two years. Her first loan of 500 nuevos soles was used as capital to purchase different types of cereals. She is now requesting a loan of 500 nuevos soles to purchase cereals, such as quinoa, barley, wheat, etc. She will sell them at the weekly fair in Llave. Her greatest wish is to continue to work to help her children. She enjoys the savings and the loan workshops.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase quinoa, barley, wheat, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 57 años de edad, estado civil soltera sin hijos y tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en la comunidad de Chojña Nati 

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 2 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de vacunos que  luego de mejorarlos los venderá en las ferias de la zona.

Su deseo seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the “Manuela de Hoy II” Community Bank, which is located in the community of Camicachi of the district of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 57 years old, single, with no children and has completed primary school. She lives in the community of Chojña Nati. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost 2 years, with an initial loan of 500 new soles for the purchase of young cattle. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 300 new soles for the purchase of cattle. After improving their condition, she will sell then in regional markets. Her wish is to continue working. She likes saving and meeting people at the bank.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cattle

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora  Lucia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 27 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 1 hijo y tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en la comunidad de Urani 

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 meses,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado ovino que luego del engorde los venderá en las ferias de Ilave.

Su deseo es educar a su hija y seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan las facilidades de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Lucia belongs to the communal bank “Manuela de Hoy II” which is located in the community of Camicachi in the district of Ilave, a province of El Collao in the department of Puno. She is 27 years old, married and the mother of one child. She has completed primary school and lives in the community of Urani. She has worked with the field partner Manuela Ramos for 4 months, taking out an initial loan of 500.00 nuevos soles which she used to purchase small livestock. At the moment she requires a loan of 1000.00 nuevos soles to buy sheep which, after fattening up, she will sell in the Ilave markets. Her desire is to educate her daughter and continue working. She likes the ease of access to credit with Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Bunthai

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthai K., age 39, and his wife, Mrs. Sokyoeun Samrit, age 29, were married in 1999 and just have one daughter who attends school. The family lives in a small village off of National Road number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Bunthai has been a plumber and electrician for 11 years. His wife has been selling grocery for one year. Nowadays, there is a pond behind his house and he wants to eliminate the pond by filing it, but he doesn’t have money. That’s why Bunthai is asking for his first loan of US$1,000 in order to use for the purpose.

loans.use: To eliminate a pond behind his house by filling it in.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 50 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 4 hijos y estudio primaria incompleta, vive en Segundo Camicachi. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado ovino, Victoria va a mejorar su ganado y luego los venderá en la feria de Ilave.

Su deseo seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan las facilidades de los préstamos y los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino.

loans.name: Dina Brigida

texts.es:
La señora Dina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 24 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y madre de 1 hijo y estudio secundaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en  la comunidad de Urani Marca Kollo. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 meses con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de fruta. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de frutas tales como plátanos, naranjas, papayas, etc. Para la venta en las ferias de  Camicachi.

Su deseo es poner una tienda de abarrotes

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los pagos.
texts.en:
Dina belongs to the Manuela de Hoy II Community Bank, which is located in the Camicachi community, Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 24, has a common law partner, and she has one child. She attended high school until her third year. She lives in the Urani Marco Kollo community. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four months. She used her initial loan for 500 PEN to buy fruit. She now needs a loan for 500 PEN to buy fruit like bananas, oranges, and papayas, etc. to sell in the fairs in Camicachi. Her wish is to set up a grocery store. She likes the ease of the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit like bananas, oranges, and papayas, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 56 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 5 hijos (3 a su cargo), estudio secundaria completa, vive en  la comunidad de Urani Marca Kollo. 

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 700.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado ovino, que luego de mejorarlos los venderá en las ferias semanales la Sra. Juana tambien se dedica a la venta de productos de la Region.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovinos.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 35 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y madre de 3 hijos y estudio secundaria completa, vive en el sector  Alpacuyo I. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ovinos. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de un toro para mejorarlo y venderlo en la feria de Ilave.

Su deseo es aumentar su ganado y poder vender a los mayoristas

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de toro.

loans.name: Ruthy

texts.en:
Ruthy R. is from the village of Gingoog, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Ruthy is widowed and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Ruthy owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Ruthy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruthy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruthy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Ruthy is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ruthy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora Guillermina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 49 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 8 hijos  (2 a su cargo) Guillermina no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, vive en la comunidad de Urani Marca Kollo. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace años, obtuvo un préstamo  inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para aumentar a su capital para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para aumentar a su capital para la compra de ganado mayor para engorde, La Sra. Guillermina se ayuda también con su chacra.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas.
texts.en:
Guillermina belongs to the Manuela de Hoy II Community Bank, which is located in the Camicachi community, Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 49, married, and she has eight children (two still under her care). Guillermina did not have the opportunity to go to school. She lives in the Urani Marco Kollo community. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for years. She used her initial loan for 300 PEN to buy small livestock. She now needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy large livestock to fatten. Guillermina also helps on her farm. Her wish is to keep working. She likes the savings and the talks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Maria Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 46 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 4 hijos y estudio primaria incompleta, vive en el sector Lupaca Pamaya. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ovinos. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, ella invertirá este dinero para la compra de ovinos que luego de engordarlos los venderá en la feria de su zona.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y ayudar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las reuniones, los ahorros y las charlas.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the Manuela de Hoy II Community Bank, which is located in the Camicachi community, Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 46, married, and she has four children. She went to elementary school, but she did not finish. She lives in the Lupaca Pamaya sector. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. She used her initial loan for 500 PEN to buy sheep. She now needs a loan for 500 PEN to buy sheep to fatten. She will then sell them in the regional fair. Her wish is to keep working and to help her children. She likes the meetings, the savings, and the talks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Leonor pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 54 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 3 hijos y estudio primaria incompleta 2do grado, vive en la comunidad de Urani Marca Kollo. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, este dinero ella lo invertirá en la compra de ovinos. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, Leonor invertirá este dinero en la compra de productos de la Región como papa, quinua, chuño, etc. Para venderlo en las ferias de la zona.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y ayudar a su familia.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas.

loans.use: Para la compra de papa, quinua, chuño, etc

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 43 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 3 hijos y estudio primaria incompleta, vive en el sector Urani Marca Kollo. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de productos de la región. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1300.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra de papas, chuño, ocas, quinua, etc. Para venderlo en las ferias de la zona.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan las reuniones,  y las charlas.

loans.use: Para la compra de papas, chuño, ocas, quinua, etc.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes A. is from the village of Gingoog, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Lourdes is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 46 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 6 hijos y no ha tenido la oportunidad de estudiar., vive en el sector Mamani.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado menor como chanchos. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra ganado menor como chancho y ovino para engorde.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan las reuniones,  y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Victoria is an associate of the communal bank “Manuela de Hoy II” which is located in the community of Camicachi in the district of Ilave, part of the El Collao province in the department of Puno. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. She has not had the opportunity to study. She lives in the Mamani sector. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 3 years. Her inital loan was 300.00 nuevos soles which she used to buy small livestock such as pigs. At the moment she requires a loan of 600.00 Nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of small livestock like pigs and sheep to fatten up. Her desire is to continue working. She likes the meetings and the ease of access to loans with Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep and pigs

loans.name: Ich

texts.en: Ich S., 26, is a low-income person living in Siem Reap Province. She is a good mother who tries to determine her one lovely young child to attain the primary school. Ich S. currently plants a variety crop on her own land. Beside her farm work, she also goes with her husband to fish along the Tunle Sap River for extra profit. She retails her fish in retail in market after she finishes fishing, while her husband depends on fishing business. In addition, Ich S. plans to raise a few pig out of her home but she lacks capital. She is looking for a loan to buy pig-food and piglet for raising.

loans.use: To buy pig-food and piglet for raising

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 31 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y madre de 4 hijos y estudio primaria incompleta 3er grado, vive en el sector Rosacani.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo utilizo en la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra ganado menor ovino para engorde.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Celia is a member of the community bank “Manuela de Hoy II,” located in the community of Camicachi of the district of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 31 years old, has a common-law husband, and is the mother of four children. She completed school through the third grade. She lives in the Rosacani area. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years. Her initial loan was 500 soles, which she used for buying young cattle. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of young sheep to fatten. Her goal is to continue working so she can educate her children. She likes parties and savings.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sheep

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 35 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 3 hijos y estudio secundaria incompleta, vive en el sector Urani Marca Kollo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo utilizo en la compra de productos de la región. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra  de papas, chuño, quinua, cebada, etc. Para la venta en los mercados de la zona.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los ahorros
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the "Manuela de Hoy II" (The Manuela of Today II) Village Bank, located in the Camicachi Community, Llave District, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She's 35, married, the mother of three children, and has an incomplete secondary school education. She lives in the Urani Marca Kollo sector. She's been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years. She used her first loan, for 300 soles, to buy products from her region. She currently needs a loan for 2000 soles which she'll invest in the purchase of potatoes, potato flour, quinoa, barley, etc., to sell at local markets. Yolanda's wish is to continue working. She enjoys the meetings and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, potato flour, quinoa, barley, etc.

loans.name: Logovaita

texts.en:
Logovaita F. is a 31-year-old married woman with three small children. The family lives in Faala where she owns and runs a business providing services to the local community. Logovaita has been engaged in this business for over five years, from which she earns approximately 1000 WST a month.

In 2008, Logovaita joined SPBD to gain access to its financial services. Logovaita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand her services. Logovaita is now requesting a second loan of 1000 WST, which will be used for the same purpose. Logovaita plans to use all profits to expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's lending philosophy is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide her services

loans.name: Norman

texts.en:
Norman M. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora, in the province of Zamboanga del Sur. He is 34 years old, married and has one school-aged child. For over ten years Norman has owned and operated a retail store where he sells clothes and shoes to the local community. He earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Norman joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. He successfully repaid his prior loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC, which he used to expand his business. Norman is now requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP that will be used to diversify his stock. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Norman from GDMPC. He plans to use his profits to improve and expand his business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand and diversify his stock

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma T. is from the village of Gingoog in Misamis Oriental province. She is 34 years old, married and has three school-aged children. Erma owns and operates a retail store in her community where she specializes in household products such as glasses, plates and plastic wares much like Tupperware. Erma has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Erma joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Erma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI used to purchase new items to diversify her inventory. Erma is requesting a second loan of 8000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional stock. She plans to use her profits to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La señora Fortunata es socia del Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 55 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 6 hijos (3 a su cargo), Fortunata no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ella  vive en la comunidad de Urani Marca Kollo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo utilizo en la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1400.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra ganado menor ovino para engorde, luego los venderá en las ferias semanales.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.
texts.en:
Fortunata is a member of the communal bank "Manuela de Hoy II," which is located in Camicachi in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno. She is 55 years old, married, and is the mother of 6 children (3 currently in her care). Fortunata did not have the opportunity to study, she lives in the community of Urani Mara Kollo. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for a year, her initial loan was for 300 nuevos soles, and was used to purchase livestock. She currently needs a loan of 1,400 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of sheep that she will fatten, and later will sell in the weekly market. Her desire is to keep working, and she enjoys saving money.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep to fatten up

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok K., 55 (pictured with her son), is a widow with three sons and five daughters. Six of them are married and live separately, one son weaves silk at home and another son is a monk. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sok has been a silk weaver for 20 years. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh market. Sok is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 50 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 9 hijos (5 a su cargo), Fortunata no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ella  vive en la comunidad de segundo Camicachi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 meses, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo utilizo en la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra de ganado menor ovino los cuales luego de mejorarlos los venderá en las ferias de la zona que se realizan una ves por semana.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos menores.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades en los pagos.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the communal bank "Manuela de Hoy II," which is located in Camicachi, llave district, El Collao province, Puna. She is 50 years old, married and the mother of 9 children (5 currently in her care). Juliana did not have the opportunity to study, she lives in the community of Segundo Camicachi. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 4 months, her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, which she used to purchase livestock. She currently needs a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, to invest in the purchase of sheep that she will raise and then later sell in the area's weekly markets. Her desire is to continue working in order to help her youngest children. She enjoys saving and having access to credit with affordable payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de ovinos

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe C. is from the village of Gingoog , Misamis Oriental. She is 38-years old and married with three school-aged children. Fe owns and operates a bakeshop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from baking and selling bread in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Fe joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng C., age 28, is a Tuk Tuk driver. He always brings his passengers to the interesting places around capital in the best territory of Siem Reap Province, such as mountains and Angkor wat Temple. Usually, he gets the highest fees from his customer because he is a skill in attracting to them and is widely known where entertainment locations. He is now married with two young children who are of school-aged. The other source of family income, his wife sells breakfast food to the neighbors in the village. Cheng C. said that he has been using his taxi years ago so his taxi is too old, small, and not attractive. He is therefore requesting a loan in order to replace his old Tuk Tuk.

loans.use: To replace his old Tuk Tuk

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 45 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 2 hijos, Carmen estudio primaria incompleta (3er grado), ella vive en la comunidad de segundo Camicachi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo utilizo en la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra ganado menor ovino para venderlos en las ferias de la zona.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the communal bank "Manuela de Hoy II," which is located in Camicachi, Llave district, Collao Province, Puno. She is 45 years old, married and is the mother of two children. Carmen attended school through the 3rd grade but did not complete primary school. She lives in the community of Segundo Camicachi. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 2 years. Her initial loan was for 500 nuevos soles, which she used to purchase livestock. She currently needs a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, to invest in the purchase of sheep that she will sell in the regional markets. Her desire is to continue working and she enjoys saving.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 47 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 6 hijos, la sra. Elsa estudio secundaria completa, ella  vive en la comunidad de Rosacani.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo utilizo en la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1700.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra ganado menor ovino y chancho, los cuales luego de mejorarlos los venderá en las ferias de la zona.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan  las facilidades en los pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Elsa is a member of the Manuela de Hoy II Community Bank which is located in the Camicachi community in the key district in the El Collao province, Puno Department. Elsa is 47 years old, married and a mother of 6 children. She completed studies through high school and lives in the community of Rosacani. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 2 years, and her original loan was for 300 nuevos soles which she used to buy small livestock. Currently Elsa requests a loan for $525 to invest in the purchase of sheep and pigs, which she will then improve and sell in the fairs in the area. Her wish is to continue working, and she likes the payment facilities.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sheep and pigs

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia T. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del sur. She is 41-years old and married with three school-aged children. Letecia owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish in the local community. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Letecia joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional dried fish to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Letecia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions and to pay the tuition of her children.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 48 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 7 hijos, tiene estudios de primaria incompleta (3er grado), ella  vive en la comunidad de Urani.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo utilizo en la compra de productos de la región. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra de productos de la región tales como papa, chuño, quinua, cebada, etc. Para venderlos en la ferias semanales.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana is a member of the Manuela de Hoy II Community Bank, which is located in the Camicachi Community in the key district, in the El Collao province, Puno department. She is 48 years old, is married and mother to 7 children. She completed studies through the 3rd grade and lives in the community of Urani. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 2 years, and her original loan was for 300 new soles, which she used to buy regional products. Currently she requests a loan of $525 to invest in products from the region such as potatoes, barley, quinoa, etc to sell them in the weekly fairs. Her wish is to keep working. She likes savings.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of regional products

loans.name: Chanvitol

texts.en:
Mr. Chanvitol T., 18, has been a hairdresser in Phnom Penh for about two years. He has five siblings and lives with his parents on National Road Number One, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. (He was not available for the photograph and was replaced by his mother.)

Chanvitol is in the process of building a new house where he lives, but he doesn’t have enough money to finish it. Therefore, he is requesting his first loan of $1,000 USD to finish the house and build a fence around it.

loans.use: To add to his own money to finish building his house and erect a fence around it

loans.name: Tay

texts.en: S. is a single woman, 22-year-old, who currently resides in the best territory of Siem Reap town, in Cambodia Country. She is a local chef. She is always hired by neighbors to cook meals for their wedding parties and their other ceremonies. She now lives with her older father who appears in the picture above. Her father works fishing in and around Tunle Sap Lake. S. will be used her first loan to buy additional fish tools, such as nets and traps for her father's fishing activities.

loans.use: To buy additional fish tools

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La señora Yaneth es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 25 años de edad, estado civil soltera y madre de 1 hijo, estudio secundaria completa, ella  vive en Jr. Laykacota 107 Ilave.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo utilizo en la compra de diversos cereales. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1800.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra de habas, cebada, quinua, cañihua, etc. Luego Yaneth los vende en las ferias semanales.

Su deseo es aumentar su negocio para tener más ganancias y así poder educar a su hijo.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los pagos

loans.use: Para la compra de habas, cebada, quinua, cañihua, etc.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon K. is from the village of Gingoog, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old and married with six school-aged children. To make a living, Corazon owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling ice candy and fruit salad in the local community. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Corazon joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
