To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Yetunde

texts.en:
Yetunde is a major distributor of detergent and toilet soap. She hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more detergent and toilet soap to sell.

Yetunde is 40 years old and the mother of five children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more detergent and toilet soap to sell

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en: N. Christine is the leader of her lending group in Namungoona. She is 34 years old and a business lady involved in the poultry business, farming and dealing in the sale of cosmetics for a long time giving her enough experience in what she does. She is a married lady with her first born 15 years and in secondary school and the loans have helped her pay her child’s school fees by investing in her businesses and getting profits. She has also bought a plot of land and built a house for her family as she also helps to care for her parents, orphans and off springs. Christine has mostly had challenges like when her chicken are attacked with diseases and they die, or at times when her farming does not yield as expected. However, she has dream like having a well vanished house, educate her eldest son whose father died to the last level, as well as buy a car that will help with a family and to help with her business. Business wise, Christine would like to have a much bigger farm that will include cows, pigs, goats and ducks or turkeys. She would also like to involve in farming extensively. She is a hardworking, friendly and trustworthy person and this wins her many peoples’ confidence.

loans.use: Buying quality seeds, employ manpower for clearing her farm land and buying more chicken feeds and chicks for farm expansion.

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Kemi sells sarongs of various colors and shapes, her sole source of income.  Forty years old and married with five children, Kemi is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet T., the leader of her lending group in Bushenyi, is a 38-year-old lady who puts a great deal of determination and hard work into all of her business and general endeavors. She is a business lady with a hotel in Kitwe town along Mbarara-Bushenyi Road that has been running for six years. Juliet says that before she started preparing meals, she had only prepared tea and a few snacks, but with the help of loans, she was able to buy saucepans, forks, spoons and plates in addition to various foodstuffs that enabled her to expand her offerings. She is now able to make a net profit of 35,000 per week which enables her to save for her children’s education, food, health and clothing. 

Juliet is a mother of three children, a 20-year-old and an 18-year-old, both secondary school students, and a 13-month-old.  She dreams of owning a bigger hotel in town so that she can increase her customer base, and she is requesting a loan to help purchase more foodstuffs for resale in a boiled form in order to meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: Buying more foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Djonmahmad

texts.en:
The agriculture business is labour intensive because it requires sun exposure, the physical exertion of moving animals, as well as the work it takes to tend to various crops. For four years Djonmahmad has dedicated himself to raising cattle to support his humble and reliant family. Currently Djonmahmad has turned to IMON International for a loan of 2500 Somoni to purchase calves to raise. It’s important to note that the granting of this loan will not only benefit him but also his dearest parents.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of young cattle

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: At the age of 25 Editha G. is already married to Vicente G. Sr., they were given a gift from God, a baby boy Edcent John, who is now 10 months old. For them to be able to survive in their daily needs like food, milk for the baby and other needs that are essential in the house, her husband work as a laborer. But the expenses are larger than the income, so she decided to start a business that will give them an extra income to support all their needs. That starts her partnership with her mother who has a variety store. She shared money to her mother to finance the store, and until now the business is still running, but the store sells limited goods. She wants to buy a lot of goods for them to sell because more goods to sell more income for them. And also she wants to rebuild their house; it is near the seashore, to a much stronger one so even if storm will visit their place they will not feeling scared. So she decided to join Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) for the capital she needed for their store and their house, and also preparing the future of her son. She really thinks that this step that she made will give them a good and better life that she’s hoping for herself and her family.

loans.use: Will be use for financing her variety store

loans.name: Zukhra

texts.en:
K. Zukhra, a widow and mother-of-one, describes herself as a hard-working and enterprising woman. She decided to start a sewing business many years ago because she wanted her child to get a good education. She started out helping a woman who ran a tailoring shop, and after learning the trade was subsequently offered a job. Eventually she started a small shop in her home. It has gone very well since then and she has been able to grow the business, making her famous in her community and increasing customer demand. Currently Zukhra is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni ($1150 USD) which she will use to purchase new sewing machine with computer-based embroidery so she can fulfill all her customers' requests. Zukhra is very grateful for your support in helping to grow her business and move ahead. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of a new sewing machine

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Twenty-four year-old Vivian is a single woman without children who sells palm oil in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes to be able to meet the high customer demand for her palm oil. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy, married with six children, lives with her family in a two-room house in Ndamukong, Cameroon. She fries and sells puff puff, Accra beans, and bananas in a Carrefour junction beside her house and is requesting a loan to buy flour, beans, palm oil and groundnut oil for frying. Dorothy plans to expand this business since puff and beans is a fast and inexpensive meal.

This will be Dorothy's sixth loan from GHAPE, of which she has been a member since 2003. She has been quite successful in her business due to her location, reasonable prices, and cooking experience, and her customer base continues to grow. Part of the profits from this loan will be used to take care of her children, buy necessities for the family, including her grandchildren, and the other part will be used to help the needy and orphans in the orphanage within her community.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying of koki beans, palm oil, groundnut oil, fruits

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.en:
Committed first and foremost to his family and his business, Khurshed works very hard at ranching. He has his own herd of cattle with which he works day after day to earn a living to support the dearest people in his life – his parents. As every business requires investment, the business at which Khurshed works needs to add some young bulls, which will be raised and sold. For this reason he turns to IMON International to obtain a loan that will allow him to acquire the cattle to help improve the standard of living of his beloved family.

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle

loans.name: Abisola

texts.en: Abisola sells notebooks, textbooks, toys and cosmetics in her shop. She has been in this business for a long time. Abisola is 40 years old and married with three children. Abisola is very enthusiastic and hopes to increase the growth of her business. Abisola is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more notebooks and textbooks to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more notebooks and textbooks to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Born in 1942, Lucy is a widower with five children, and five grandchildren below the age of 15, under her care. She lives at Mile 90, Nsongwa Mezam Division, Bamenda, Cameroon. She is a very hardworking lady. She was unhappy with the death of her husband and three children due to hardship. Though she did not make it through school because of lack of home training, ignorance and especially poverty, she is still determined to succeed in life and provide for her children what her parents could not do for her. 

With this loan she plans to invest in farming and firewood sales. She is going to provide her community with wood for burning and food for her family and community. She will buy seeds like beans and corn. Experience has taught her how to manage a business like this one. Besides that, the firewood business site is located in a very good area. She will use the profits for educating her grandchildren and providing necessities and medication for them.
 
Lucy loves GHAPE because of the low interest rate and the social interaction among members. These interactions bolster her loan utilization and management.   

 The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and wood

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.en:
Since he was very young, N. Mirzoali has dedicated himself to the raising of livestock. He is a married father who needs to support his children though they no longer need his help to complete their studies. His wife also helps him with the business. Mirzoali is faced with the need is to purchase calves. In order to then commercialize the derivative products, the raised animals are sold to farmers who resupply the small farmers with calves. To acquire the animals, Mirzoali comes to IMON International to obtain the necessary credit to purchase them and in this way continue to maintain his dear home.

loans.use: Purchasing calves

loans.name: Bibizahroy

texts.en:
S. Bibizahroy is an enterprising, capable and very hardworking woman. She lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan, and sells women’s clothes. She began her own business because her husband was unemployed for some time. Her work is allowing her three children go to school. It is very important to Bibizahroy that her children finish school and become honest, hardworking individuals. 

You can help Bibizahroy provide for the education of her children. She needs a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy merchandise in order to increase sales. She wants to continue to support her children and wishes to work in order to achieve this.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for women for the spring season

loans.name: Vali

texts.en:
Vali A. is 43 years old. Together with his wife he has been raising cattle for more than 3 years. This produces the income which allows him to feed his  wife and 3 children . As well as caring for his livestock, Vali also cultivates agricultural crops which helps with the family's diet and provides additional income. Vali has asked for this loan to buy young cattle in order to obtain a better profit. His greatest wish is to be able to improve his farm by constructing enclosures and establishing better grazing for his livestock.

loans.use: Purchasing of young cattle

loans.name: Abam

texts.en:
Abam  E. is married to Grace Numfor and they are blessed with 4 children above 15 years of age. E. and his entire family are living in a house with 3 bedrooms and one sitting room. As a very hard working man, Abam has faced many challenges in life such as the death of his mother and father in the same year and a robbery costing him huge sums of money and destruction of materials. The latter problem made life very difficult for him because he was sponsoring two children in the university at the time. In  the year 2006, Abam saw GHAPE as a source of relief and became a member.
	
Abam plans to buy cows with his loan. Repayment of the loan will start at  the fourth month from the day of disbursement He is convinced that the business will succeed because of the experience he had have in it and he is well known in the community. He is going to provide the community with meat, skin material for the manufacture of other commodities. Not forgetting the trust those in his community have for him.
	
Abam plans to use the profit from the loan and that of previous loans to, pay for his children school fees, feed and cloth his family. With all these, he will enjoy a better and comfortable life. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because it offers trainings before giving out loans, proper follow up is done after the loan is disbursed to ensure proper usage of the loan, and the method of repayment is convenient and comfortable.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Fareed

texts.en: Fareed is 22 year old single man. He lives in the city of Jericho in Palestine. Fareed owns a radio station and he is requesting a loan of $2000 USD to purchase a well-functioning computer, which he is lacking in his business, as well as other pieces of equipment needed in running a radio station. He wants to offer high quality service to his clients and the community.He says thanks to all who have made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and other pieces of equipment needed in running a radio station

loans.name: Abdusalim

texts.en:
Abdusalim  G. is 21 years old. He is married but has no children yet. He arduously dedicates himself to the livestock business. When Abdusalim recognized the need to invest in his work, he decided to construct a place to keep his animals and for this he requires certain construction materials. He has sought the help of IMON believing that his loan request will be granted and with this he will be able to move forward in his work. With the loan Abdusalim will purchase young cattle and construction materials for improving his cattle-shed.

loans.use: Purchasing of young cattle and construction materials for improving his cattle-shed

loans.name: Uzezi

texts.en: Uzezi P. sells smoked fish. She purchases the fresh fish  from the market and she smokes the fish to sell to her customers. She loves this business because she makes a lot of profit from it.. Uzezi is 32 years old and married with 5 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100000 to purchase more fresh fish. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 27-year-old man, married and with one child. He lives in Nabatieh (South Lebanon), and he has been repairing cars for ten years. Youssef has been a microcredit client for five years now, and he has always paid on time. His previous loans affected him positively as he gained experience and determination. 

Youssef has faced some difficulties, however, in attracting customers. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase better tools and reimburse his debts. Youssef hopes that with upgraded equipment he will be able to provide better service and so expand his clientele.

loans.use: To purchase tools and reimburse his debts

loans.name: Bobogoib

texts.en:
Bobogoib G. is 24 years old, married and has two children. He lives in Isfara where he processes and sells dried apricots in the local market. He is experienced in marketing dried apricots; he purchases apricots from local farmers at wholesale, then processes them for sale to his customers. Because he buys his goods wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He also offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means.

All this has made Bobogoib’s business quite successful and has provided a stable income for his family. He is currently requesting a loan of $600 USD to buy more supplies so as to continue to offer a good assortment of products to his customers. Bobogoib would like to express his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

More about Tajikistan:

loans.use: Increasing his range of goods for sale

loans.name: Fumi

texts.en: Fumi sells foodstuffs like rice, beans, palm oil, etc. She is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Bih

texts.en:
Bih H. is a widow with four children. She lives in Nitop in Bamenda, Northwest Cameroon. Being a widow, she must fend for herself and her children, in this case through her firewood business. Additionally, Bih has encountered problems such as illness within the family and problems faced by her son in the Southwest region, costing Bih much money to remedy the situation. Notwithstanding that, Bih H. is quite ready to fight through life to the last moment with every morsel of her strength.

This is why she became a GHAPE beneficiary in 2008. She prefers to work with GHAPE because their loan conditions work well for her. This is Bih’s second loan from GHAPE. She plans to buy firewood, then transport and split it. Firewood is always needed in her community, so her business is sure to be successful. With the profits from this loan, she plans to pay for her children's school fees and other educational needs and pay off medical bills. She hopes this loan will improve her and her family's standard of living.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business and financial management, basic health maintenance, life skills and family values. Clients are also required to deposit a small amount of money into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community among its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase firewood to split and sell

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima, born in 1956, lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with her husband and her five children. Fatima has been working as a seamstress for thirty-six years. She has requested $1800 from Al Majmoua (a Kiva field partner) to buy a new sewing machine and thread to improve her work quality. She has been a microcredit client for six years now and she always pays on time.
Fatima hasn’t faced any difficulties and her determination to do well makes her unique. She hopes that her business will continue to be successful.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and thread to improve her work quality.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is 26 years old and married with two young children. Amal lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, where she sells clothes and fabric. She has been in this business for four years and she is requesting a loan of $2000 from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, to repair the transportation van she uses to sell her products. She is good at what she does and her clients are mainly her friends and neighbors.

Amal hasn’t faced any problems and she hopes to expand her working space and improve the quality of her products in the future.

loans.use: To repair the transportation van she uses to sell her products.

loans.name: Hilola

texts.en:
K. Hilola is 28 years old. She and her husband have two children. Hilola bakes “lepeshka” at home, which is a flatbread and is considered to be the national bread of Tajikistan. Her husband (pictured) helps her with the business. Hilola sells the majority of her products from home. However, she has also hired a salesman who runs the trading place in the central local market for selling the "lepeshka”. Hilola is doing her best to give her children the best future she can. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 2000 Somoni. She is planning make wholesale purchases of the flour she needs for her business. Hilola is grateful to all who support her and promises to manage the loan meticulously.

loans.use: To buy the flour wholesale that she needs for baking lapeshka.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an additional cow.

loans.name: Zebijon

texts.en:
R. Zebijon is a hard working woman and since 2005 has dedicated herself to selling a variety of vegetables in the central market of Kanibadam. She characterized herself as happy and humble. She started her business with her savings which she had accumulated over a long period of time. Zebijon is the mother of two children that she would like to offer an education as they are minors. She now requests 2000 Somoni. With this loan she wants to buy more goods to increase her earnings.

loans.use: Increasing of the range of vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farming products and merchadise for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To redecorate his bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing young cattle

loans.name: Chadi

texts.en:
Chadi is a 27-year-old engaged man. He lives in Bint Jbeil in southern Lebanon, where he works as an electrician. Chadi requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy some tools and gear for his work and also to save some money for his wedding. This is Chadi’s second year as a micro-credit client.

Chadi knows how to run his business and he has been working for six years now. He is unique because of his skills and expertise in solving electricity problems. His clients are mainly friends, neighbors and tourists. He hopes to get married in the future.

loans.use: To buy some tools and gear for his work and also to save some money for his wedding

loans.name: Abdukhalil

texts.en:
M. Abdukhalil is married and has three children who he is very proud of since they are fighting to get ahead. With the faith that his children would go to college to get ahead he started a business of processing and selling the dried apricot to be able to make enough money to pay for their schooling. This is why he started this business two years ago. He is experienced in this kind of business that allows him to expand his clientele day by day. Right now Abdukhalil requests $ 600 USD for purchasing dried apricot further to process it and to sell. With your help, Abdukhalil will be able to feel proud that through much effort, his children went to college and are honorable people. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy dried apricot for expanding his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an additional cow.

loans.name: Salem

texts.en: Salem is 46 years old, married with 3 children. He lives in Bint Jeil, southern Lebanon, where he owns an electricity generator. Salem requests a loan from Al Majmoua to buy cables and wires. It is Salem’s first time as a microcredit client. He has been working for 16 years and his clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. He provides electricity to his clients whenever the power is down in the region. He had difficulties in the past with procuring clients but this worked out and his future plan is to expand.

loans.use: To buy cables and wires.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana is the mother of two children, and she was born in 1970. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Gubadli region, and is now settled in Baku city.

Eight years ago she started her business of running a small general store. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy foodstuffs in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for resale at a small general store.

loans.name: Makbouli

texts.en:
Makbouli is 41 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives in southern Lebanon, where she owns a bedcover shop. She requests a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy products and decorate her shop. It is Makbouli’s third cycle as a microcredit client and she has always paid on time.
Makbouli’s clients are mainly her friends and neighbors. She has faced some competition in the past but managed to make a name for herself in the region. Makbouli hopes to expand more and succeed in making her business well-known.

loans.use: To buy products and decorate her shop.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is a 27-year-old father of one who owns a boutique in the Mukuru slums of Nairobi. He has been in this business for the past five years. Dennis is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings in order to add to his stock of clothes. Dennis hopes to expand his business to other locations one day. He describes himself as hardworking.

About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy more stock of clothes for resale at a used clothing shop.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is 40 years old, married with five children.  He lives with his family in southern Lebanon, where he owns a sweets factory. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new ovens for his factory. It is Bilal’s first time as a microcredit client.

Bilal’s clients are mainly friends and neighbors. He faced financial problems in the past but managed to overcome them. Bilal hopes to expand in the future and increase his product types.

loans.use: To buy new ovens for his factory.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 35-year-old married man and he has one child. He lives in Bint Jbiel, southern Lebanon, where he works as a carpenter. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new tools and material, such as wood and metal, for his work. Mohamad has been working as a carpenter for ten years now.

He is known for his commitment and determination to finish the job right. His clients are his neighbors and friends. Mohamad faced some difficulties starting off, but now that all is well he hopes to gain more experience and receive better and bigger deals.

loans.use: To buy new tools and material (wood, metal) for his work.

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami is a scrap metal dealer. He is applying for his fourth loan from Komak, and this loan will be the second of his funded by Kiva lenders. (See the Kiva page for Nizami's first loan)

Nizami is enjoying his business. He needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy metals to further improve his business.

loans.use: To buy metal for a scrap metal shop.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is 30 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon and owns a grocery store. In his store, Youssef sells all kinds of food products as well as computer and electronic games.

Youssef is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new products for his store. It is his second year as a microcredit client.

Youssef has faced financial problems in the past. He hopes to expand his store and increase the types of products he sells in the future. Youssef is known for his people skills as well as his expertise in running businesses.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a grocery store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Stellamaris

texts.en:
Stellamaris is a 40-year-old business lady who owns a clothing boutique in Nairobi. She has been in this business for the past three years. Stellamaris is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings in order to add to her stock of clothes.

A mother of four, Stellamaris hopes to educate her children, buy her family a home in Nairobi and become a clothes supplier one day. She describes herself as development-conscious and outgoing.

About Faulu Kenya:

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy stock for a clothing boutique.

loans.name: Juddy  Wanja

texts.en:
Juddy is twenty nine years old and married to Benson Munene who is a driver. They have two children named Maurine Wahu seven years and Martin Kariuki five years.

The client has been in this business for two years. She was introduced to KADET by existing clients and has no other loans from other MFIs. The client intends to use the loan to buy more stock for her kiosk. The client's business is located beside residential houses and has a steady flow of customers. Juddly believes that she is very persistent and hardworking. She hopes the extra profit generated from this loan will help to expand her business and eventually allow her to open another outlet.


ABOUT KADET LTD.

Kadet Ltd is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya that was formed in 2000 to offer access to financial services to the rural communities through the microfinance model. Kadet is the only microfinance in Kenya with a strong rural presence and a genuine concern for the welfare
of children and the communities we serve. As a member of the Association of Microfinance Institutions in Kenya, Kadet has continued to empower communities by providing access to easy-to-pay loans. Loan products available at the MFI are designed to offer solutions to challenges facing
communities in these rural habitations. Obtain more information on Kadet from the press section of the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The client intends to increase stock of flour, sugar, milk and bread.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is 34, married, and the father of three children. He owns a shop where he sells computer-related items and accessories, and provides maintenance services.

In order to boost his sales and to provide better customer service, Jamal is requesting a loan in the amount of U.S. $2,000. He will use this loan to purchase computer accessories. Become a part of the success of this business by helping Jamal improve it. He greatly appreciates your support!

loans.use: Purchase computer accessories.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha sells foodstuffs like bags of rice and vegetable oil. Aisha has been in this business since the past 10 years. Aisha is 45 years old and married with 5 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Al Sadik Group

texts.en:
The group name is A. S.; it is made of five ladies, who are living in the region of the Bekaa, Lebanon. 

-Nasra is a 49 year old woman with eight children. Nasra has been working as agriculture for thirt years. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her work. This is the first time that Nasra has requested a loan. 
Nasra is speciA. in her work because of her experience. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Nasra decided on doing her business because it is a demanding work in her region. In the future, she plans on expanding her work. 

-Sobha is a 42 year old woman. Sobha has been working as agriculture for twenty years. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her work. This is the first time that Sobha has requested a loan. 
Sobha is speciA. in her work because of she likes what she does. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. In the future, she plans on improving her work. 

-ManA. is an 18 year old woman. ManA. has been working as agriculture for five years. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her work. This is the first time that ManA. has requested a loan. 
ManA. is speciA. in her work because of her experience. Her clients can be anybody from her region. In the future, she plans on improving her work. 

-Amira is a 24 year old married woman with three children. Amira has been working as agriculture for ten years. She owns a livestock. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Amira has requested a loan. 
Amira is speciA. in her work because of her experience. Her clients can be anybody from her region. In the future, she plans on improving her work by expanding her livestock. 

-Najah is a 41 year old married woman with seven children. Najah has been working as agriculture for twenty two years. She has owned a livestock for ten years. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Najah has requested a loan. 
Najah is speciA. in her work because of her experience. Her clients can be anybody from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided on doing her business because that was the demand in her region. In the future, she plans on improving her work.


About Group Loans 
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individuA. loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To increase their livestocks.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing has been selling used clothes for over 2 years. This business is the source of her income. She is 30 years old and married with 5 children. Blessing hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more used clothes to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jane Musangi

texts.en:
Jane is forty four years old and married to Titus Kitonyo, who is forty nine years old. They have two children, named Alex and Susan, who are 18 and 15, respectively.

Jane has been in the business of tailoring and motorcycle transport for nine years. She has no previous loans from other microfinance institutions, and was introduced to KADET through existing borrowers.

Janet will use this loan to open a separate tailoring shop, as she now works from home. Jane works in a semi-slum area and her main clients are residents of the slum. Jane plans to use the extra profit she anticipates as a result of this loan to save and buy another motorcycle. Jane believes she is focused and her hopes and dreams are to own several motorbikes for her business. ABOUT KADET Kadet Ltd is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya that was formed in 2000 to offer access to financial services to the rural communities through the microfinance model. Kadet is the only microfinance in Kenya with a strong rural presence and a genuine concern for the welfare of children and the communities we serve. As a member of the Association of Microfinance Institutions in Kenya, Kadet has continued to empower communities by providing access to easy-to-pay loans. Loan products available at the MFI are designed to offer solutions to challenges facing communities in these rural habitations. Obtain more information on Kadet from the press section of the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To expand a tailoring business by opening a new shop.

loans.name: Khémesse

texts.fr: Khémesse N. est une veuve âgée de 62 ans, mère de 12 enfants. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt s’activer dans l’embauche ovine. Son objectif est de développer son activité pour mieux prendre en charge les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Khémesse N. is a 62 year old widow who is the mother of 12 children. With this loan she wishes to set up a sheep business. Her goal is to build up her business in order to better take charge of the family expenses.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise sheep

loans.name: Francisca Kemuma

texts.en: Francisca is twenty seven years old and married to thirty-two-year-old Jones Omambia. Her husband works when he can find work. They have one child called Brian Obaka who is six years old and in first grade. Francisca has been in the tailoring business for five years and was introduced to KADET through existing clients. She has no other loans from other microfinance institutions. Francisca works in a semi-slum area and her clients are mainly residents of the area. She intends to use the loan to stock up on material and stock-liners to sell to other tailors. She plans to save the extra profits generated as a result of this loan. Francisca aspires to have a big tailoring shop and to open up new branches. About KADET: KADET Ltd. is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya that was formed in 2000 to offer access to financial services to the rural communities through the microfinance model. KADET is the only microfinance organization in Kenya with a strong rural presence and a genuine concern for the welfare of children and the communities it serves. As a member of the Association of Microfinance Institutions in Kenya, KADET has continued to empower communities by providing access to easy-to-pay loans. Loan products available at the microfinance institution are designed to offer solutions to challenges facing communities in these rural habitations. Obtain more information on KADET from the press section of the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To stock materials to sell wholesale to other tailors

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou N. est une jeune femme de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes et de poissons. Cette activité lui permet de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.

loans.use: Commerce de légumes et de poissons

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells crates of drinks and pepper soup. Elizabeth is a very energetic and vibrant business woman. She is 58 years old and married with four children. She is requesting a loan of 160,000 nairas to purchase more crates of drinks and soup ingredients. She says thank you!

loans.use: To purchase drinks and soup ingredients

loans.name: Ndèye Amy

texts.fr: Ndèye Amy N. est une jeune femme de 29 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle fait du commerce d'arachide et en meme temps de l’embauche ovine. elle souhaiterait renforcer son activité, Ceci pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndèye Amy N. is a 29 year old young woman who is married and the mother of 3 children. She sells peanuts and at the same time she fattens sheep. She wishes to increase her business in order to contribute better to improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling peanuts and also fattening sheep

loans.name: Agnes Kerubo

texts.en:
Agnes has been in the rental housing business for five years. Agnes's business is in a slum area, serving low income earners who reside in the slum. She intends to use her loan to renovate the floors of her rental houses. With the extra profit generated as a result of the loan, she plans to build more rental houses. 

Agnes is 41 years old and married to 42-year-old Peter Mbaruka. Peter works for a security firm. They have three children called Faith Mora (22 years old), Damaris Mwende (17 years old) and Viona Mumbua (5 years old).

Agnes was introduced to KADET by current members, and she has no loans from other MFIs. Agnes states she is trustworthy and her hopes and dreams are to own several rental houses.

ABOUT KADET
KADET Ltd. is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya that was formed in 2000 to offer access to financial services to rural communities through the microfinance model. KADET is the only MFI in Kenya with a strong rural presence and a genuine concern for the welfare of children and the communities served. As a member of the Association of Microfinance Institutions in Kenya, KADET has continued to empower communities by providing access to easy-to-pay loans. Loan products available at the MFI are designed to offer solutions to challenges facing communities in these rural habitations. Obtain more information on KADET from the press section of the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To renovate the floors of rental houses

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy J. runs a pharmacy in Mkoroshoni, Mombasa, a short distance from his residence in Shanzu. He has been in the pharmacy industry for three years and mainly serves the residents of Shanzu. He was introduced to KADET by a group member and he is now accessing his first loan to boost his business. He plans to purchase antibiotics, anti-fungals and analgesics for his pharmacy. Kennedy hopes to eventually be able to open a clinic in his home area and offer more services to the area residents.

Kennedy is 45 years old. He is married to Pamela Adhiambo and they are blessed with three children: Stephen, Rodgers and Fred Kennedy.

ABOUT KADET KADET Ltd. is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya that was formed in 2000 to offer access to financial services to rural communities through the microfinance model. KADET is the only MFI in Kenya with a strong rural presence and a genuine concern for the welfare of children and the communities served. As a member of the Association of Microfinance Institutions in Kenya, KADET has continued to empower communities by providing access to easy-to-pay loans. Loan products available at the MFI are designed to offer solutions to challenges facing communities in these rural habitations. Obtain more information on KADET from the press section of the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To purchase antibiotics, anti-fungals and analgesics for his pharmacy

loans.name: Mame

texts.fr: Mame D. est une femme mariée 45 ans. Elle s’active dans l’embauche bovine et ovine. Ce prêt lui servira à renforcer son élevage et ainsi à mieux améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille.

loans.use: Faire de l'embauche bovine et ovine

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa N. est une femme de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle fait de l’embauche bovine et aimerait développer son activité. Son objectif est de contribuer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awa N. is a 42 year old woman who is married and is the mother of 2 children. She fattens cattle and would like to develop her business. Her goal is to contribute to the support of her family.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fatten cattle

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget sells loaves of bread in retail to her customers within her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 50 years old and married with 10 children. Bridget hopes for the loan amount of N80, 000 to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Fatou Ngom

texts.fr: Fatou Ngom S. est une dame de 59 ans, veuve et mère de 2 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de mil et de la transformation de mil pour la vente aussi. Elle aimerait développer son activité  et mieux participer aux dépenses familiales.

loans.use: Commerce et transformation mil

loans.name: Diakhou

texts.fr: Diakhou N. est une jeune femme marié, âgée de 36 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Elle fait un petit commerce d’oseille. Son objectif est de renforcer son commerce et contribuer à la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Diakhou N. is a young married woman, is 36 years old, and is the mother of 5 children. She has a small business selling sorrel. Her goal is to increase her business and to contribute to the payment of the family expenses.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sorrel business

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a member of The Dawn village bank. She is 39 years old and has been a widow for nineteen years. She has one son who is 23 years old, is married and has a daughter of his own. They all live together in Juana’s house.

Juana became pregnant with her son when she was 14 years old. She decided to work selling food from her house. Sadly, for years she suffered from kidney problems and had to stop working for a while. When her health improved, she decided to start selling clothes to her neighbors and this business is currently going well.

Since joining FINCA Juana feels more secure because of the loans and she has learned how to save. She needs a loan of 1,200 soles to pay for clothes and to place more orders for clothes. Her dream is to have more clients.

loans.use: To pay for clothes and to place more orders for clothes

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a member of The Dawn village bank. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children who are 20, 17, and 1. Her two eldest are studying in a technical institute and she takes care of her 1-year-old daughter.

Silvia started selling beauty products via catalogue. She joined her village bank four years ago and decided to start a convenience store. She began buying showcases and supplies and little by little her store has been growing.

Since she joined FINCA Silvia’s working capital has increased and her business has grown. She is happy because she has received rewards for making her loan payments on time.

Silvia needs a loan of 1,400 soles to buy a freezer because she doesn’t want her food to spoil. Her dream is to grow her business and to renovate her showcase cabinets.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for her store

loans.name: Yoshiko Sujey

texts.en:
Yoshiko is a member of The Dawn village bank. She is 25 years old, lives with her partner, and has a two-year-old daughter she takes care of. Yoshiko has seven older brothers.

After finishing high-school Yoshiko wasn’t able to continue her studies because she didn’t have any money to do so. When she lived with her parents, her father worked as a taxi driver and her mother worked taking care of her and her brothers. She had to leave the house and work cleaning houses. Unfortunately, she became ill and had to stop working.

When she was well again, Yoshiko decided to sell clothes with the money that her husband had given her. She works hard everyday selling clothes in the market from nine in the morning to seven in the evening.

Since joining FINCA, Yoshiko has learned to save and invest the money she receives from loans. She has been able to earn more money and is able to meet all her orders. She needs a loan of 1,400 soles to buy clothes. Her dream is to have both civil and religious marriage ceremonies.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Julia Del Pilar

texts.en:
Julia is a member of The Dawn village bank. 
She is single, 50 years-old and has no children. 
Julia has always been a storekeeper and makes her living through sales. She decided to start a convenience shop in her house that was successful for many years. Unfortunately, she had to close it because her mother got sick and she had to care for her. Her mother is 91 years-old and needs a lot of attention, and because Julia is the only single sibling she has the responsibility of caring for her. Therefore, Julia decided to sell clothes and beauty products via catalogue in order to give her and her mother more time together. 
Since joining FINCA Perú, she has received loans that have helped her out of many tough situations. They have also helped her invest in more beauty products. 
Julia needs a loan 1200 soles to buy beauty products. Her dream is that her mother will remain healthy and that she will be able to open a new convenience store.

loans.use: buy beauty products

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge has raised his son from the age of six, because his wife left to work in another country. He had a job in a bakery for 12 years. With his savings, he bought a place in the market and started a juice shop. He works in the juice shop serving breakfast everyday, from 7 in the morning to 10 at night.

Jorge is 59 years old and married. He has a 20-year-old son who works in the mornings and is also studying at university to acquire a systems engineering degree.

Jorge is a member of the Valley Roses Village Bank. Since joining FINCA, Jorge has learned to manage his business better and is thankful for the business skills he has acquired at the village bank. Jorge needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy bread, carbonated drinks and fruits for his store.

loans.use: To buy bread, carbonated drinks and fruits for his store

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifanía is from Huancavelica. She came to Lima when she was a child and finished her studies. Later she began to study sewing, dressmaking, and cosmetology. Every weekend people come to her house for her services and she says that she makes more in her business than any other business she’s been in. She likes the business she runs out of her home, and appreciates that her mother is able to help her.

Epifanía is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and doesn’t have any children of her own but is taking care of a child from her sister’s first marriage. She is raising the child as if it were her own.

Epifanía is a member of the Valley Roses Village Bank. Since joining FINCA, she has learned to save her money and to be in solidarity with her group members. Epifanía needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy groceries, three sacks of rice, three sacks of sugar, and two jugs of oil. Her dream is to have her own place in the market where she can sell groceries.

loans.use: To buy groceries, three sacks of rice, three sacks of sugar and two jugs of oil

loans.name: Fredy Cesar

texts.en:
Fredy is a member of the Valley Roses village bank. He is single, 24 years-old, and has a 3-year-old daughter who lives with her mom and goes to kindergarten. 
Fredy and his parents came from Junín to Lima after he finished his studies in school. He started studying English in the evenings but had to stop because he could not afford to keep spending the money. 
He started to work in a textile business near his house but stopped because they moved to another district and he was spending a lot on transportation. He saw an opportunity to work in San Juan as a taxi driver. He contacted the taxi company and was able to rent a taxi.
Since he has joined FINCA he has had the opportunity to increase his income. Fredy needs a loan of 1200 soles to make the initial payment on his taxi. His dream is to someday own his own taxi.

loans.use: Make the initial payment on his taxi

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is from Ayachucho, which is in the mountains of Peru. She was not able to complete her education and was only able to finish the fourth graD. when she was brought to Lima to live with her sister. At 17 years old, she began to work in houses as a maid. She did this for some time but stopped in order to dedicate more time to her children. Later, she got a job in a bakery where she learned how to make cakes, pies, and cookies. She worked there until she decided to go into business for herself. She now rents a place where she sells juices and breakfasts.

Victoria is 54 years old, married, and has five children. Only her youngest child lives with her; he is 16 years old and has finished his studies at the public school.

Victoria is a member of the Valley Roses Village Bank. She acknowledges that joining FINCA has been a great help in accessing more capital and administering her business more efficiently. Victoria needs a loan of 800 soles to buy an exhibition stand. Her dream is to move away from the market where she currently sells, because it is very dangerous.

loans.use: To buy an exhibition stand

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria sells foodstuffs like tomatoes, pepper, onions, etc. she is 38 years old and married without a child. She hopes for the loan amount of N80, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr: Cette dame est revendeuse de produits génériques ; elle exerce cette activité de manière ambulante mais aussi dans le marché d’Agoè Adaugbo les jours de marché. Elle est mariée à un ferrailleur et le couple a 03 enfants. C’est en 2006 qu’elle a pris la décision de vendre les produits génériques à la mode actuellement à Lomé, pour aider financièrement son mari dans l’éducation scolaire de leurs enfants. Elle a besoin de renouveler son stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 01 carton de Paracétamol, 01 carton d’Amodiaquine, 02 cartons de Zudrex, 02 cartons d’Efferalgan. Elle compte sur sa meilleure connaissance du marché pour agrandir son commerce dans un bref délai.
texts.en:
This woman is a retailer of generic products. She does this business from door to door but also in the market of Agoè Adaugbo on market days. She is married to a scrap dealer and they have 03 children. She decided in 2006 to sell generic products in fashion currently in Lomé in order to support her husband financially in the education of their children. She needs to replenish her stock. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Wages in order to buy 01 of paracetamol, 01 carton of Amodiaquine, 02 cartons of Zudrex, 02 cartons of Efferalgan. She counts on her profound knowledge of the market in order to increase her business in the shortest possible time.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of generic products

loans.name: Clémence

texts.fr: Clémence M. est une femme de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle fait du commerce d’arachide, de mil, d’oseille et de haricot. Ce prêt lui servira de développer son activité et les revenus générés à participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

loans.use: Commerce d'arachide, de mil, d'oseille et de haricot

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat de bois de chauffage

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: Louise P. est une femme de 67ans, veuve et mère de 3 enfants. Elle fait de l’embauche porcine qu’elle aimerait développer. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Louise P. is a 67 year old woman who is a widow and the mother of 3 children. She would like to develop her business fattening pigs. Her goal is to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening pigs

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Monsieur Koffi est un jeune homme qui a terminé ses études de gestion à l’Université de Lomé. Il a cherché d’emploi dans plusieurs institutions de la place mais n’a rien trouvé de favorable. C’est pour éviter d’être toujours à la charge de ses parents qu’il a décidé en 2007 de se lancer dans la vente de bois de chauffage dans son quartier de Bè à Lomé. Il est connu de beaucoup de personnes ; certaines personnes viennent acheter du bois de chauffage chez lui par curiosité, car c’est un commerce souvent réservé aux dames. Il sollicite pour renouveler son stock presque épuisé, un crédit de WAGES pour commander 02 camions de bois de chauffage. Il est célibataire et sans enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi is a young man who finished his studies in management at the University of Lomé. He looked for a job in several area institutions but did not find anything desirable. In order to avoid continuing to be supported by his parents he decided in 2007 to start selling firewood in Bè, his neighborhood in Lomé. He is known by many people. Some people come buy wood from him out of curiosity because it is a business often reserved for women. To replenish his almost exhausted stock he is requesting a loan from WAGES to order 2 truckloads of firewood. He is single and without children.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood

loans.name: Bokoli Plus Group

texts.fr:
Hélène N. 56 ans, est dirigeante du groupe dénommé “Bokoli Plus”. Cette banque communautaire est solidairement unie pour recevoir des crédits auprès de l’Institution de Microfinance Hope RDC en sigle IMF HOPE RDC. Elle est constituée de 25 membres.
Hélène gère son propre dépôt des sacs maїs et de manioc qu’elle vend il y a plusieurs années. Elle a acquit une expérience solide dans ce domaine et elle est bien connue dans son milieu à cause de la qualité de ses marchandises. C’est grâce à la confiance qu’elle bénéficie de sa clientèle que son affaire prospère. Elle est cliente fidèle qui a obtenu 7 fois les prêts de l’IMF HOPE RDC et les a retournés correctement. Le prochain crédit de Kiva à travers l’IMF HOPE RDC lui servira à acheter 10 sacs de maїs et 3 sacs de manioc à revendre. Actuellement, son activité lui génère un bénéfice de $10 par jour. Son ambition à court terme est d’agrandir la capacité de son dépôt afin de répondre à la demande de ses clients et d’accroitre le revenu. Son affaire se situe dans la partie montagneuse à l’ouest de la ville de Kinshasa. Hélène est veuve et mère de 8 enfants âgés de 20 à 41 ans. Trois d’entre eux sont étudiants.
texts.en:
Hélène N., age 56, is the manager of a group named “Bokoli Plus”.  This community bank is united in solidarity for receiving loans from the micro-finance institution Hope RDC, having the acronym IMF HOPE RDC.  The group is composed of 25 members.  Hélène manages her own warehouse for sacks of corn and cassava that she has been selling for several years.  She has acquired solid experience in this domain, and she is well-known in her area because of the quality of her merchandise.  Thanks to customer trust from which she benefits, her business is prospering.  She is a loyal client who has obtained seven different loans from IMF HOPE RDC and who repaid them properly.  Her next Kiva loan through IMF HOPE RDC will be used to purchase ten sacks of corn and three sacks of cassava for resale.  Right now, her business generates a profit of $10 a day for her.  Her ambition in the near-term is to expand the capacity of her warehouse in order to respond to the demands of her customers and to grow her revenues.  Her business is located in the mountainous area to the west of the city of Kinshasa.  Hélène is a widow and the mother of eight children, ages 20 to 41 years old.  Three of them are students. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of corn and 3 sacks of cassava

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou T. est une femme de 52 ans, veuve et mère de 9 enfants. Elle s’active dans l’embauche bovine et ovine. En même temps aussi elle fait de la transformation en huile de l’arachide. Elle aimerait renforcer son activité pour mieux prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou T. is a 52-year-old woman, a widow, and the mother of nine children. She is active in fattening cattle and sheep. At the same time, she also processes peanuts for the oil. She would like to bolster her business to support her family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fatou THIAW est une femme de 52 ans, veuve et mère de 9 enfants. Elle s’active dans l’embauche bovine et ovine. En même temps aussi elle fait de la transformation en huile de l’arachide. Elle aimerait renforcer son activité pour mieux prendre en charge sa famille.	Fatou THIAW is a 52-year-old woman, a widow, and the mother of nine children.  She is active in fattening cattle and sheep.  At the same time, she also processes peanuts for the oil.  She would like to bolster her business to support her family better.  Faire de l'embauche bovine et ovine et de la transformation de l'arachide en huile To fatten cattle and sheep and to process peanuts for oil

loans.name: Talahahou

texts.fr: Cette femme a appris la couture et est mariée à un journaliste. Le couple n’a pas d’enfant. Elle a ouvert sa boutique de couture dans le quartier d’Agoè Zongo à Lomé. Malheureusement elle ne trouve pas de clientes mais doit toujours payer les frais de location de son atelier. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle a décidé l’année dernière de commander une moulinette artisanale pour rendre le service consistant à écraser du piment et tomate en grande quantité, et bien d’autres condiments de cuisine. Cette nouvelle activité lui permet désormais de réaliser de bons chiffres d’affaires ; elle a beaucoup de clients actuellement. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter une autre moulinette dans le but de satisfaire à temps sa clientèle. Elle pense recruter un jeune homme pour cette future acquisition.

loans.use: Achat de moulinette de fabrication artisanale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a small hand-made mill

loans.name: Ahou

texts.fr: Cette femme est spécialisée dans la vente des produits d’alimentation générale à Agoè Démakpoè à Lomé. Elle est mariée et est mère de 03 enfants. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière au foyer. Sa boutique d’alimentation est très visitée par beaucoup de clients de ce quartier très peuplé de Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne le plus souvent au Grand Marché de Lomé. Elle vend à la fois en gros et en détail ; sa clientèle est essentiellement composée de revendeuses ambulantes. Actuellement elle veut se lancer dans la vente d’huile, de riz, de couscous et autres. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 05 bidons d’huile, 05 sacs de riz, 05 sachets de couscous, 02 cartons de lait, 03 sacs de maïs, 15 bouteilles d’eau minérale Voltic et différents cartons de savons de toilette. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2005 et compte sur sa longue expérience pour vite rembourser ce prêt.

loans.use: Achat des produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a selection of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat des produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Cette dame s’est spécialisée depuis 2005 dans la vente de produits d’alimentation générale, plus précisément la vente d’huile de palme  et d’huile blanc. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière au foyer. Elle s’approvisionne lu plus souvent à Tsévié, à une trentaine de kilomètre de Lomé, mais aussi à Kpalimé sur moins de cette distance. Elle vend ses produits à la devanture de sa maison dans le quartier de Tokoin Tamé à Lomé. C’est pour renouveler son stock presque fini qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour commander 50 bidons d’huile de palme et 45 bidons d’huile blanc. Ce prêt lui permettra également de couvrir ses frais de transport vers les mieux d’approvisionnement.
texts.en:
In 2005, this lady became specialized in selling grocery items, palm oil and white oil to be precise.  She is married and the mother of two children.  This business allows her to bring her financial share to the household.  She usually stocks up in Tsévié, located about 30 km from Lomé, and also in Kpalimé, which is less distant.  She sells merchandise in the entryway of her house in the Tokoin Tamé district in Lomé.  To renew her almost-exhausted stock, she's requesting a WAGES loan to order 50 containers of palm oil and 45 containers of white oil.  This loan will also enable her to cover the costs of transport to places with better supplies.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Bénète Plus Group

texts.fr:
Kakala N. 42 ans, est présidente d’une banque communautaire dénommée « Bénète Plus » qui est composée de 28 membres qui se sont solidairement constitués et se sont engagés à obtenir des prêts auprès de l’IMF HOPE RDC.
Kakala vend des produits vivriers tels que des céréales et autres produits dans la partie montagneuse située à l’ouest de Kinshasa. Elle est entrée dans le monde de micro entreprise depuis 2005. Elle a déjà reçu 4 fois les crédits de l’IMF HOPE qu’elle a remboursé totalement et à temps. Elle compte avec le prochain prêt de Kiva à travers l’IMF HOPE RDC, acheter la semoule de maїs qu’elle revendra pour faire prospérer son affaire qui lui génère aujourd’hui un bénéfice de $40 par semaine. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un grand dépôt des céréales qui sont beaucoup recherchés dans son milieu. Kakala est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 9 et 19 ans. Tous vont à l’école.

loans.use: acheter la semoule de maїs à revendre pour faire prospérer son activité

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Inti.
Maria es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Maria compra y vende de ganado, los cuales son adquiridos en las ferias y los comercializa en la feria de animales, además Maria se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno en el distrito de Santiago de Pischa.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una res.
Los sueños de Maria son construir su casa y comprar un carro para alquilar.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Inti Community Bank. She is 32 years old, living with someone, and has 2 children.

Maria buys and sells cattle, which are acquired in local fairs, and sells them in the animal fair. She also fattens cattle in Santiago de Pischa District.

Maria needs $500 to buy one head of cattle. Her dreams are to build her house and buy a car to rent out.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY ONE HEAD OF CATTLE

loans.name: Vidalina

texts.es:
Vidalina es socia del Banco Comunal Inti.
Vidalina es casada, tiene 71 años y 12 hijos, Vidalina tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, carne, helados, también tiene teléfonos públicos. Además Vidalina y su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta D. madera.
Vidalina necesita un préstamo D. 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideo, gas.
Los sueños D. Vidalina son comprar un carro y terminar D. construir su casa.
texts.en:
Vidalina is a member of the Inti Community Bank. Vidalina is 71 years old, married, and has 12 children. She runs a store out of her house where she sells general groceries, produce, meat, ice cream, and she also has public telephones. In addition, Vidalina and her husband buy and sell lumber. Vidalina is requesting a loan of 1,800 soles ($625) to invest in buying rice, sugar, pasta, and gas. Vidalina's dreams are to buy a car and to finish the construction on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, pasta, and gas for her store

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with a son. She lives and works in Novomoskovsk, a town in the south-eastern part of Ukraine.

Tatyana sells multiple-glazed units, vinyl windows and doors and launched this enterprise three years ago. She owns a small office in downtown Novomoskovsk next to a busy bus station. She already makes 65,000 Grivnyas in gross income.

Tatyana is requesting a loan of 10,400 Grivnyas to further develop and expand her business, introducing new kinds of merchandise.

Tatyana's small business is well known in her town and the region for high quality plastic extrusions and reasonable pricing policy. This type of merchandise is in good demand which encourages her to develop her small venture even further.

loans.use: To grow her business

loans.name: Akouvi Elom

texts.fr: Madame Akouvi habite le quartier de Bè-Kpota à Lomé. Elle est mariée à un jeune conducteur de taxi-moto. Le couple a un enfant à leur charge. C’est difficilement que son mari arrive à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. C’est pour apporter son aide financière à son mari que cette dame a pris la décision en 2002 de se lancer dans la vente de certains condiments de cuisine. Elle exerce son activité dans le marché très fréquenté de Bè-Kpota à Lomé. Actuellement elle a besoin de renouveler son stock ; elle sollicite donc un crédit de WAGES pour acheter au Grand Marché de Lomé 30 paniers de tomates naturelles, 03 grands sacs de gingembres, 15 sacs de piments verts. Ce prêt lui permettra aussi d’acheter 05 sacs de maïs et 03 sacs d’oignons.
texts.en:
Madame E. lives in the Bè-Kpota neighborhood in Lomé. She is married to a young motorcycle taxi driver and they have one child. Madame E.'s husband has difficulty providing for the family, so to help him with the finances, she decided to start up a business in 2002 selling cooking condiments. She conducts her business activity in the very busy Bè-Kpota market in Lomé. She currently needs to replenish her inventory, so she is requesting a loan from Kiva Field Partner, WAGES, to buy 30 baskets of natural tomatoes, three large sacks of stem ginger and 15 sacks of green peppers from the Big Market in Lomé. This loan will also allow her to buy five sacks of corn and three sacks of onions.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural tomatoes, peppers, ginger, onions and sacks of corn.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana es socia del Banco Comunal Inti.
Viviana es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Viviana tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hijo. Además Viviana viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende papa, carbón, verduras de acuerdo al pedido.
Viviana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Viviana son construir su casa de material noble y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.

loans.use: Para la compra de cereales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat des pièces détachées de motos

loans.name: Petro

texts.en:
Petro is married with two grown kids – a son and a daughter. He is an entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk. He is in business selling polythene film, plastic wrap and decorative film in the busy central industrial market of his home town. Petro used to run a private firm but it went bankrupt and he had to try his luck some place else. This is how he ended up as a small businessman. Petro has been in this trade for 9 years. Currently, his monthly profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas. 

Petro is seeking a loan of 10,400 Grivnyas to buy 15 assorted rolls of plastic wrap (25 meters each), 5 rolls of polythene film (100 meters each) and 15 rolls of decorative film (50 meters each). This business is the main source of income for his family which is why Petro works hard to keep it running and thriving. One of his long-term plans is to make enough savings and buy an apartment for his daughter. Petro’s wife is helping him run his business which he admits is a huge help in a competitive marketplace business.

loans.use: to purchase additional polythene film

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Inti.
Elizabeth es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Elizabeth junto a su cuñada se dedican a la compra de ganado en las diferentes ferias y los comercializa en la feria de San Juan. Además Elizabeth tiene un salón de belleza y vende cosméticos por catalogo.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado.
Los sueños de Elizabeth son tener casa propia y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Inti Community Bank. Elizabeth is 38, married, and she has two children. Elizabeth, together with her sister-in-law, buys livestock at different fairs and sells them at the San Juan fair. Also, Elizabeth has a beauty salon, and she sells cosmetics by catalog. Elizabeth needs a loan for 1,600 PEN to buy livestock. Elizabeth’s dreams are to have her own house and that her children complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Inti.
Carmen es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, Carmen junto a su esposo tienen un taller de planchado y pintura en un local alquilado, además compran y venden carros.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos.
Los sueños de carmen son tener casa propia y un taller propio.

loans.use: Para la compra de repuestos.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 20 inner tubes, 20 tires, 15 pedals, 25 spark plugs, and various other spare parts

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
