Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Inti.
Isabel es casada, tiene 52 años y 5 hijos, Isabel tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Isabel necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños D. Isabel son que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Inti Community Bank. Isabel is 52, married, and she has five children. Isabel has a stall in the Magdalena market where she sells general groceries. She does this every day. Isabel needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy rice and sugar. Isabel’s dreams are that her children become professionals; she also wants to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Arly Antonio

texts.es: El señor Arly P. de 34 años de edad, tiene una pequeña fábrica textil desde hace dos años, el trabajaba en la zona franca en mecánica industrial, sus planes era poder tener su propio negocio ya que el salario es bajo y mucho lo que se trabaja. Reside en la comarca Sabana Grande en la capital de Managua, junto a su esposa que le tiene tres hijos de 7,9 y 11 años de edad, los cuales están en la  escuelita del barrio. Ella es costurera y junto a el se apoyan para cada día poder lograr sus objetivos, con este crédito es para comprar una maquina de coser industrial para seguir con el proceso de su negocio. Con esto espera incrementar más negocio, vender más, y seguir adelante,  después comprara otra maquina cover industrial y poder tener las herramientas necesarias para su costura. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Arly P., is 34 years old, and since two years ago he owns a little textile factory. He works in the zona franca** in industrial mechanics. He plans to have his own business since his salary is too low and work is hard. He lives in the Sabana Grande region in the capital, Managua, with his wife and three children who are 7, 9 and 11 and go to a local school. Mr. P. and his wife, who is a seamstress, rely on each other so that each day they can accomplish their goals. With this loan they will buy an industrial sewing machine to continue with the development of their business. With it, he hopes to boost more business, sell more and persevere. Later he will buy another industrial sewing machine and have the necessary tools for sewing. He is thankful to Kiva partner, Afodenic, for the opportunity to expand his business. **Translator's note: The Zona Franca is a governmental organization that regulates exportation from Nicaragua. See www.cnzf.gob.ni for more info (in Spanish). Taken from Olivia Engkvist.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Kossi Essenam

texts.fr: Ce monsieur dispose d’un entrepôt de vente de maïs dans le quartier d’Atiégou à Lomé. Il a ouvert cet entrepôt depuis 2000 et ce commerce lui permet de vendre à des femmes grossistes, revendeuses au grand marché de Lomé. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de ses 02 enfants. Son entrepôt est très connu de beaucoup de vendeurs de maïs. Il reçoit ses commandes de plusieurs villages de l’intérieur du pays. Pour lancer de nouvelles commandes, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 20 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
This gentleman owns a corn warehouse and selling point in the Atiégou neighborhood in Lomé. He opened this warehouse in 2000, and this business enables him to sell to women who buy wholesale and resell at the grand market in Lomé. This business enables him to provide for his wife and his two children. His warehouse is known to many corn sellers, and he gets his orders from several villages in the interior of the country. To launch new orders, he's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 20 sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of corn

loans.name: Miriam Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Miriam del Socorro tiene 46 años de edad, con once años de experiencia en la costura, pues tiene una sastrería, desde joven su mama la puso a estudiar un curso de costura para que se pudiera defender en la viada el cual le agradece en vida ya que ha sido su fuente de ingreso. Reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua junto con su esposo que también es sastre y han logrado apoyarse mutuamente para poder sastifacer las necesidades del hogar. Tienen dos hijos  de 20 y22 años los cuales trabajan y estudian. Con este crédito lo quiere para comprar telas variadas, hilos y otros que necesitan para hacer la costura. También necesita comprar otra maquina de coser industrial para mejor funcionamiento del negocio lo cual lo hará mediante otro crédito que le permita la institución, espera poder obtener las ganancias necesaria y poder pagar el crédito en tiempo y forma  y tener la oportunidad de los financiamiento.
texts.en:
Miriam del Socorro is 46. She has 11 years of experience sewing. She has a tailor’s shop. When she was young, her mother had her study a course on sewing so that she could take care of herself. She is grateful because this has been her source of income in life. She lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She lives with her husband, who is also a tailor. They have been able to mutually support each other to meet the household needs. They have two children, 20 and 22. They work and go to school. With this loan she wants to buy various fabrics, thread, and other necessities for sewing. They also need to buy another industrial sewing machine to improve the business. She will do that through another loan from the institution. She expects to be able to get the necessary income, be able to pay the loan on time as agreed upon, and have the opportunity for other loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various fabric, thread, and others

loans.name: Homegnon Kossi

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme est le Directeur d’un établissement de débit de boisson très connu à Lomé appelé « First Class ». Cet Etablisssement fait aussi office de bar-dancing. Ce débit de boisson est très visité par beaucoup de jeunes et des touristes visitant le quartier de Bè à Lomé. Actuellement il  a besoin de renouveler son stock; c’est pour cette raison qu’il voudrait avoir un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 10 casiers de bière Lager, 15 casiers de bière Eku Bavaria, 20 casiers de Guiness et un nombre significatif de boissons gazeuses et des sucreries. Ce jeune homme est célibataire et sans enfant.

loans.use: Achat des casiers de boissons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat de casiers de boissons

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La señora Josefa Hernández de 49 años de edad, es una mujer esforzada que ha logrado salir adelante en su vida con su negocio. Tiene 49 años de edad, reside en el barrio anexo Villa Libertad en la capital de Managua, casada y con cinco hijos que procreo tres mayores de edad independiente y dos están estudiando, su esposo es albañil, su negocio es la venta de tortillas desde hace dos años se ha dedicado a la venta de tortilla, anteriormente vendía comida por encargo, pero cada día vendía menos lo cual cambio de negocio lo cual le daría mejores utilidades ya que el bastimento de todos los Nicaragüenses, para sastifacer las necesidades de su familia. Sus planes es poder ayudar a sus hijos  a que estudien para que tengan un nivel de vida mejor, ya que desde horas tempranas me levanto para ir a moler el molino, ya que por las noches dejo nesquizado el maíz y comienzo a palmear las ricas tortillas. Con este crédito comprara maíz, maseca, leña, gas y productos lácteos. Sus planes es hacer un bajarete  en donde palmea para dar un mejor servicio y una mejor a apariencia al negocio.  Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad de lograr el incremento de inventario y poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Josefa Hernández is 49 years old and lives in the neighborhood annex of Villa Libertad in the capital of Managua. She is a courageous woman who has managed to get ahead in life as well as in her business. Sra. Josefa is married and has five children, of which three are independent while the other two are students. Her husband works as a bricklayer.

Sra. Josefa has been selling tortillas for two years. She previously sold fast food, but her sales were decreasing so she changed her business in order to improve her income. She decided to sell tortillas because it is a staple for all Nicaraguans and it would help her provide for her family’s basic necessities. Her plans include helping her children with their education so that they can have a better quality of life. Sra. Josefa wakes up in the early hours to begin grinding the corn after it has soaked overnight. She then begins shaping the tortillas.

With her loan, Sra. Josefa will purchase corn, flour, firewood, gas and dairy products. She hopes to build a covered patio where she can make her tortillas and provide better service, as well as give her business a nicer appearance. She thanks the Institution for the opportunity to increase her inventory so that she can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, flour, firewood, gas and dairy products

loans.name: Alozouhoin

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et mère d’un enfant. C’est une vendeuse ambulante de pagnes de qualité de toute sorte. Elle vend ses pagnes dans le quartier très vaste de Gbégnédji à Lomé. Elle est très connue de beaucoup de personnes. Son commerce porte sur les pagnes Vlisco, Wax Hollandais et Hitarget. Elle reçoit ses commandes des femmes revendeuses de pagnes de qualité au Grand Marché de Lomé appelées les « Nanas Benz ». Pour renouveler son stock, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 pagnes Vlisco, 10 pagnes Hitarget et 05 pagnes Wax Hollandais.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of one child. She's a traveling saleswoman, who sells quality pagnes (colorful African cloth) of all sorts. She sells her pagnes in Gbégnédji, a vast neighborhood in Lomé. She's well known to many people. Her business concentrates on Vlisco, Wax Hollandais, and Hitarget pagnes. She gets her orders from women, called "Nanas Benz", who resell quality pagnes at the grand market in Lomé. To renew her stock, she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, to buy 15 Vlisco pagnes, 10 Hitarget pagnes, and 5 Wax Hollandais pagnes.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 Vlisco pagnes, 10 Hitarget pagnes, and 5 Wax Hollandais pagnes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Sauces de Compañía.
Hilda es casada, tiene 51 años y 7 hijos, Hilda se dedica a la agricultura en sus tierras de la comunidad de Compañía, produce verduras que luego comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Hilda necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de semillas y abono.

loans.use: Para la compra de semillas y abono.

loans.name: Alozouhoin

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et mère d’un enfant. C’est une vendeuse ambulante de pagnes de qualité de toute sorte. Elle vend ses pagnes dans le quartier très vaste de Gbégnédji à Lomé. Elle est très connue de beaucoup de personnes. Son commerce porte sur les pagnes Vlisco, Wax Hollandais et Hitarget. Elle reçoit ses commandes des femmes revendeuses de pagnes de qualité au Grand Marché de Lomé appelées les « Nanas Benz ». Pour renouveler son stock, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 pagnes Vlisco, 10 pagnes Hitarget et 05 pagnes Wax Hollandais.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of one child. She's a traveling saleswoman, who sells quality pagnes (colorful African cloth) of all sorts. She sells her pagnes in Gbégnédji, a vast neighborhood in Lomé. She's well known to many people. Her business concentrates on Vlisco, Wax Hollandais, and Hitarget pagnes. She gets her orders from women, called "Nanas Benz", who resell quality pagnes at the grand market in Lomé. To renew her stock, she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, to buy 15 Vlisco pagnes, 10 Hitarget pagnes, and 5 Wax Hollandais pagnes.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 Vlisco pagnes, 10 Hitarget pagnes, and 5 Wax Hollandais pagnes.

loans.name: Koriko

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’Agoè Nyivé à Lomé où elle vend des vêtements de friperie de toute catégorie ; elle est mariée et est mère de 03 enfants. C’est pour aider son mari maçon à supporter les charges financières de leur foyer qu’elle a décidé en 2004 de vendre des vêtements de friperie. Actuellement elle n’a pratiquement plus de stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 bals de friperie de catégorie diverses. Elle est persuadée que ce nouvel achat améliorera encore plus leur vie quotidienne.
texts.en:
This woman livs in the Agoè Nyivé neighborhood in Lomé, where she sells second-hand clothing of all sorts. She's married and the mother of 3 children. In order to help her husand, a bricklayer, with the household expenses, she decided to start selling second-hand clothing in 2004. She's now almost out of stock, this is why she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 15 bales of second-hand clothing of all sorts. She's sure that his new purchase will improve their daily life.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 bales of second-hand cloting

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Sauces de Compañía.
Ana es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Ana junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, el quemado del ladrillo lo realizan en el horno de su suegro.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 300 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de los peones.
Los sueños de Ana son mejorar su negocio y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Communal Bank “Sauces de Compañía”. She is 27 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 children. Together with her husband, they operate a business making handmade bricks, which are baked in an oven owned by her father-in-law.

She needs a loan of 300 soles in order for her to pay her workers. Ana dreams of improving her business and owning her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay her workers

loans.name: Nestor Javier

texts.es: El señor Néstor Javier López , tiene la edad de 40 años , habita en el barrio Santiago , ubicado en el municipio de la Concepción , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen tres hijos a su cargo todos estudiantes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a su hijos en sus estudios para que sean unos profesionales  , don Nestor desde hace 30 años se dedica a la agricultura, el inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres ya que era el medio para subsistir en su familia. Los planes hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo. Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y poder mejorar la producción, da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad de poder hacer crecer y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Néstor Javier López is 40 years old and lives in the Santiago neighborhood in the town of Concepción. He and his wife work and support one another with the household expenses. They have three dependent children, who are all students. His plans include improving his family’s living conditions and supporting his children with their education so that they can become professionals.

Don Nestor has been involved in agriculture for 30 years. He started farming with the help of his parents since this was how they supported their family. He would like to diversify his crops. With this loan, he will buy fertilizers and supplies in order to improve his production. He thanks the Institution for the opportunity to expand and improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & supplies for improving production

loans.name: Lizbeth Jesenia

texts.es:
Lizbeth es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era.
Lizbeth es conviviente y tiene 19 años, Lizbeth junto a su pareja se dedican a la venta de cebiche de manera ambulatoria, actividad que realiza todos los días, además su esposo vende filtros de carro en las ciudades de la selva ayacuchana.
Lizbeth necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de filtros de aceite.
Los sueños de Lizbeth son tener un local estable y estudiar contabilidad.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is a member of the Comunal Nova Era Bank. She is 19 years old and lives with her partner. They make a living by walking around the streets selling ceviche, an activity that they perform on a daily basis. In the top of that, her partner sells car oil filters in the neighboring cities of Ayacucho, Peru. Lizbeth needs a $1025 loan that she will use to buy oil filters. Lizbeth dreams of having a stable home and to go to school for Accounting.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oil filters

loans.name: Maria Casilda

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era.
Maria es casada, tiene 57 años y 2 hijos, Maria compra cereales D. las diferentes ferias y pueblos, sus productos los comercializa en el mercado D. Las Américas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. maíz, trigo, cebada.
Los sueños D. Maria son mejorar su negocio y tener un puesto propio, estable.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the New Era Community Bank. She is married, 57 years old and has two children. She buys grains from different fairs and towns, and markets them in the Las Américas market, which she does every day. She needs a loan of $875, which will be invested in the purchase of corn, wheat, and barley. Maria's dreams are to improve her business and establish her own stand.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of corn, wheat and barley

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: El señor Luís Alfonso R. López , tiene la edad de 55 años , habita en el barrio Los Ríos , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante en la venta de carne de  cerdo , para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene cinco hijos , dos de ellos independiente y los tres estudiantes actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Luís desde hace 22 años se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas,  los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es reforestar y trabajar la tierra en conservación de suelo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizante e insumos y poder mejorar  siembra para poder vender a mejor precio en el mercado. Da las gracias a la institución por los préstamo ya con este seria el noveno el cual ha logrado mejores resultados.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Alfonsto R. L. is 55 years old and lives with his wife at Los Rios district in the town of Ticuantepe, Nicaragua. His wife works selling pork meat to help with the household expenses. They have five children, two of them are on their own and the three others are currently students. The family wishes to improve their life conditions. Mr. Luis has been a farm worker since he was 22, and plans to reforest and work on his land for soil conservation. He plans on buying fertilizers and improve the seeding, in order to sell his food for a better price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Adjoa Bella

texts.fr: Cette dame a décidé, en 2004, de se lancer dans la vente de produits d’alimentation générale pour couvrir les besoins financiers de son foyer. Elle est mariée et depuis que son mari a eu sa retraite, elle a vite compris qu’elle doit exercer une activité génératrice de revenus pour faire vivre son foyer. Pour avoir un nouveau stock, elle souhaite avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 12 bidons d’huile, 20 cartons de pâte alimentaire spaghetti, 05 cartons d’huile et divers produits comme 15 cartons de savons de toute sorte. Elle exerce son activité dans le quartier Agoè Assiyéyé à Lomé.
texts.en:
In 2004 Madame A. decided to start selling general food products to cover her household expenses. She is married, and after her husband retired, she quickly understood that she would have to generate some income to keep the household going. In order to purchase new stock, Madame A. would like a loan from Kiva Field Partner, WAGES, to buy 12 cans of oil, 20 boxes of spaghetti, five cases of oil and various other products such as 15 cases of different soaps. She conducts her business activities in the Agoè Assiyéyé neighborhood in Lomé.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase general food products.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Cette dame a très vite compris qu’elle doit exercer une activité génératrice de revenus pour supporter les frais scolaires et l’éducation de ses 03 enfants. Elle est veuve ; pour cela elle vend depuis 1983 des produits d’alimentation générale. Sa boutique est très fréquentée par beaucoup de clients, car elle a une manière particulière de bien accueillir les gens. Elle a besoin actuellement de renouveler son stock ; c’est pourquoi elle a sollicité un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 10 bidons d’huiles et 10 sacs d’oignons.

loans.use: Achat des produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era.
Antonia es soltera, tiene 39 años y 1 hija, Antonia se dedica a la compra de cereales y luego los procesa en el molino de su hermana, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Antonia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada.
Los sueños de Antonia son tener un molino propio, su hija culmine sus estudios y sea profesional.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the communal bank Nueva Era (New Era). Antonia is single, 39 years old, and has one daughter. She purchases cereal grains and later processes them in a mill owned by her sister. She sells the processed grains in the markets of the city of Ayacucho.

Antonia needs a loan of 1,000 soles that she will invest in the purchase of wheat and barley.

Antonia dreams of having her own mill, and seeing her daughter finish her studies and become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase wheat and barley

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Alejandra es casada, tiene 60 años y 10 hijos, Alejandra venD. carne D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery garcía, los animales los adquiere en las ferias. Además Alejandra tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.
Alejandra necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ganado ovino.
Los sueños D. Alejandra son ampliar sus negocios.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Flora es casada, tiene 46 años y 3 hijos, Flora junto a su esposo tienen una empresa de transporte de turistas, cuenta con 3 unidades que son manejados por choferes y ella se encarga de la administración.
Flora necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en el acondicionamiento de un bus.
Los sueños de Flora son ampliar su empresa con mas unidades y tener otro negocio.

loans.use: Para acondicionamiento de un bus.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Maura es viuda, tiene 56 años y 6 hijos, Maura venD. queso D. manera ambulatoria D. casa en casa, además Maura tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, frutas, verduras.
Maura necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. quesos.
Los sueños D. Maura son que su hijo ultimo culmine sus estudios y su negocio mejore.

loans.use: Para la compra de quesos.

loans.name: Raquel De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Raquel de los Ángeles R. , tiene la edad de 39 años , habita en el barrio Los Ríos , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo , el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen tres hijos , los cuales estudian actualmente estudian y le apoyan con las actividades agrícolas en sus tiempos libres , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Raquel desde hace 26 años se dedica a la agricultura  ella inicio está actividad con el apoyo de su mamá ya que ha sido su medio de vivir y de salir adelante pues trabajar la tierra es difícil por que se necesitan muchos recursos el cual abecés no los tiene es por eso opta por el financiamiento y poder mejorar la siembra con los químicos que requiere, los planes futuros hacia el cultivo es diversificarlo con la solicitud de préstamo comprara los materiales y químicos necesarios para obtener mejores resultado en sus cultivo.

loans.use: Comprar abonos para mejorar la siembra

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Reyna es casada, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Reyna tiene una panadería en su casa, en donD. elabora panes típicos, cuenta con 3 operarios, sus ventas los realiza por mayor en los mercados y terminales terrestres.
Reyna necesita un préstamo D. 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. leña y harina.
Los sueños D. Reyna son que sus hijos estudien y comprar maquinas para implementar su horno.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the communal bank Amor y Verdad (Love and Truth). She is married, 35 years old, and has 4 children. Reyna has a bakery in her house, where she bakes typical (Peruvian) breads with 3 workers. She makes the majority of her sales in the markets and in bus terminals.

Reyna needs a loan of 2,500 soles that she will use to purchase firewood and flour.

Reyna dreams that her children will be able to get an education and that she will be able to purchase equipment to improve her oven.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase firewood and flour

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Jacinta es casada, tiene 35 años y 5 hijos, Jacinta tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, frutas, verduras, además Jacinta vende ropa en las diferentes ferias de la región.
Jacinta necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa.
Los sueños de Jacinta son construir el segundo piso de su casa y tener un carro.
texts.en:
Jacinta is a member of the communal bank Amor y Verdad (Love and Truth). She is married, 35 years old, and has 5 children. Jacinta has a store in her house where she sells a variety of groceries including fruits and vegetables. In addition, she sells clothes in various markets in the region.

Jacinta needs a loan of 1,500 soles that will be used to purchase clothing.

Jacinta dreams of adding a second story to her home and having a car.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat de bidons d'huile et de sacs d'oignons

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Carmen es soltera, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Carmen tiene cabinas de Internet en la selva ayacuchana, en casa de su mama, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su sobrino, además Carmen vende medicina naturales.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la remodelación del Internet.
Los sueños de Carmen son construir su casa y establecer su negocio en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank Love and Truth.

She is single, 27 years old and has one son. Carmen has an internet cafe in the Ayacuchana jungle in her mothers’ house, which she runs with the help of her nephew. Moreover, she sells natural medicine.

Carmen needs a loan of 3000 soles (US $1,025), money that will be invested in the remodeling of the internet cafe. Carmen dreams of building her house and set up her business in the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel an internet cafe.

loans.name: Paula Argentina

texts.es: La señora Paula Argentina A., tiene la edad de 38 años, habita en el barrio Los Martínez, ubicado en el municipio de La Concepción;  junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene tres hijos uno de ellos independiente y los otros estudiantes de secundaria, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Paula desde hace 26 años se dedica a venta y compra de frutas y verduras el cual se vende mucho la dificultad es cuando la alza de precios aumenta y las ventas bajan por que no la quieren comprar. Los planes hacia un futuro en su negocio es poder expandirse. Con el préstamo va a comprar frutas y verduras para dar un mejor servicio cada día a sus clientes. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de estos séptimos ciclos el cual ha logrado invertir en su negocio.

loans.use: Comprar frutas y verduras

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Lucrecia es casada, tiene 50 años y 3 hijos, Lucrecia tiene una librería y Multiservicios llamado AyL, que esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad en un local alquilado, en donde vende artículos de escritorio, equipos de computo y otros servicios.
Lucrecia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de útiles de escritorio.
El sueño de Lucrecia son ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: la compra de útiles de escritorio.

loans.name: Kossi Bai Edwige

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier Totsi à Lomé où elle s’est spécialisée depuis 1999 dans la vente de pagnes de qualité. Elle vend le plus souvent à des fonctionnaires de l’administration publique où elle reçoit beaucoup de demandes. Elle est très connue de beaucoup de personnes. Son stock actuel est en baisse. Pour cette raison elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 12 pièces de pagnes Holland de haute qualité, 17 pièces de pagnes Phoenix de qualité supérieure. Elle est mariée et aide son mari à subvenir aux besoins de leurs 02 enfants.

loans.use: Achat de pagnes de qualité

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Victoria es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Victoria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar y arroz.
El sueño de Victoria es brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank Love and Truth.

She is married, is 42 years old and has 4 children. Victoria has a store in her home where she sells groceries, an activity which she does everyday.

Victoria needs a loan of 1000 soles (US $350), money that will be invested to buy sugar and rice.

Victoria’s dream is to give a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar and rice.

loans.name: Nokwaredie Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 55 years old she is married and the mother of six children. Two of her children are in school whiles the rest are working. She is very resourceful to her family in provision of food and payment of bills. She is a farmer, food vendor and sells kenkey with fried fish taking with pepper spice. She sells kenkey in the mornings and in the afternoon. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nokwaredie’ which literary means ‘Truthfulness’. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Humble Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40years old. She is married with three children, all of whom are currently in school. She is a trader in kente cloth, which is a traditional cloth designed with Ghanaian symbols rich in meaning. It is usually purchased by members of the upper class and those who earn good incomes. Elizabeth takes goods from the kente weavers in Kumasi and treks them to the regional capital of Ghana. She is requesting a loan to buy more kente cloth to meet her market demand.

Elizabeth is the leader of a trust bank group called “Humble.” (She is the one sitting in the photograph.) Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, farmers, etc. In this group members guarantee for one another, which creates social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more kente cloth

loans.name: Savior Group

texts.en:
Ama is 47 years old and she is a widowed mother with four children. Two of her children are in school. She operates a drinking spot where she sells all kinds of drinks such as soft drinks, canned malts, canned and bottle drinks, etc. She is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide for her business and to provide the children with quality education, but she claims that without adequate funds, it won’t be possible to realize that dream. She has been running the drinking spot for six years now. She needs the loan to buy assorted drinks like Coke, Pepsi and canned drinks to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Savior’. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks like Coke, Pepsi and canned drinks to upgrade her inventory.

loans.name: Koami

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme a appris le métier d’imprimeur dans une imprimerie de bonne renommée. Ces temps-ci à cause de la concurrence de plus en plus élevée sur le marché de l’imprimerie, il a décidé en 2006 de se lancer dans la vente d’articles scolaires, en particulier les livres. Depuis qu’il a commencé ce nouveau commerce, il a constaté qu’il réalise de très bonnes affaires. Il reçoit même des commandes entières des écoles privées de la capitale ; c’est pour lancer une nouvelle commande qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 45 livres du cours primaire, 50 livres du collège et bien d’autres livres essentiels. Il est célibataire et sans enfants. Il compte signer des accords d’engagement avec d’autres collèges d’ici peu.
texts.en:
This young man learned the trade of printer in a reputable printing house. Because of the increasing competition that exists nowadays in the printing trade, in 2006 he decided to start selling school items, books in particular. Since starting this new venture, business has been going very well. He even receives entire orders from private schools in the capital. To take on a new order, he is requesting a loan from Kiva Field Partner, WAGES, to buy 45 books for primary school, 50 books for high school and many other essential books. Mr. Atissousi is single and has no children. He hopes to sign agreements with of other high schools very soon.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school provisions.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et est mère de 02 enfants. En 1999, elle s’est lancée dans la vente de pagnes de différentes catégories. Elle exerce cette activité de manière ambulante. Ce commerce lui permet d’apporter son aide financière à son mari électronicien, pour subvenir aux besoins de leurs enfants. Elle vend le plus souvent ses pagnes à des femmes fonctionnaires d’Etat et des salariées du secteur privé. Actuellement elle a un besoin urgent de renouveler son stock ; c’est dans cet objectif qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter au Grand Marché de Lomé 15 pagnes de qualité Wax Hollandais, 10 pagnes Hitarget 15 pagnes Soso. Le reste du prêt lui permettra d’assurer ses frais de transport vers le lieu d’approvisionnement.

loans.use: Achat de pagnes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Janet is 62years old she is divorced and mother of five children. One is a trader whiles the rest of the children are farming in their inherited farmland. She is resourceful mother who works very hard to provide food and support for her business.  She is a petty trader and sells at the community market square; she enjoys selling, a business through which she makes a living. She sells items like cooking oil, pepper, spices, toilet soap etc. on top of a table in the market. She takes stock of goods from the Kumasi central market which is a nearby city and her surrounding communities for the vegetables. She is requesting for the loan to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, spices, pepper, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 45 years old she is married and mother with six children. Three of her children are working unfortunately the rest dead. Her husband died eleven years ago. To support her household, she has been selling cereals like maize, beans, cassava flour and groundnuts in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. She says selling of these products is very lucrative and therefore she wants the loan to expand her inventory to enable her make good income to support her family. She takes delivery of stock from suppliers in the northern region of Ghana and retail to her customers. With the loan she knows she can pick enough from the market place she would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like groundnut and beans

loans.name: Rupi

texts.en:
"Rupi F. (0) is a 42 years-year-old woman living in the town of Faleasiu.  She is married and has 8 children adult -aged children.  To make a living, Rupi owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Rupi has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 400 tala WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rupi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Rupi is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD.    Rupi is now requesting a new loan of 1000 tala WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Rupi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

loans.name: Apineru

texts.en:
Apineru V. is a 26-year-old woman living in the town of Nonoa. She is single and does not have any chlidren. To make a living, Apineru owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting bananas for sale. Apineru has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Apineru joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Apineru has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment. Apineru is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Apineru plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is 37 years old. She is married with four children, all of whom go to school. For the past four years, she has been a local manufacturer of palm oil, which is produced from palm nuts that undergo several processes. She produces and supplies the oil to food vendors, who use it to prepare their meals, and she even treks to villages to purchase the finished product when demand becomes very high. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts and barrels to store the oil, which will increase her efficiency by allowing her to produce in larger quantities.

In addition to her palm oil business, Abena also sells used clothing. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support her husband, to provide food for her family, and to finance her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more bags of palm nuts and barrels to store her oil

loans.name: Agbanari

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de Kagomé à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Son mari est revendeur de batteries d’alimentation d’appareils cellulaires au port. En 2005, elle s’est lancée dans la vente d’appareils électroménagers car son mari n’arrive plus à couvrir tous les besoins financiers de leur foyer. Cette  activité lui permet donc d’apporter sa contribution financière au foyer. Elle réalise de bonnes affaires ces temps-ci à cause de sa connaissance par de nouveaux clients. Elle sollicite pour renouveler son stock, un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 10 micro-ondes, 05 cuisinières, 50 fers à repasser, 10 moulinex, O5 ventilateurs.

loans.use: Achat d'appreils électroménagers

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos 2 Group

texts.en:
Bladimir is the group coordinator of "Unidos Venceremos" (Together We Are Victorious) which is based in a community surrounding La Romana where electricity and running water (none of which is potable) is unreliable at best. Here he makes his home with his wife and two adolescent children in a rented home with concrete walls and a tin roof.

Bladimir plans to use this loan to invest in his business selling fruit juice and small pastries, which is the family's primary source of income. He will purchase a sack of flour, two and a half sacks of sugar and five dozen varieties of fruits.

Bladimir came to Esperanza with the goal of improving his business through access to credit, and is now on his third loan after having successfully repaid the first two. With the added benefits coming from increased productive capacity, Bladimir hopes to be able to move out of his rented home and purchase his own home. In the long term, he dreams of one day purchasing a truck to help expand his mobile fruit juice business. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, cups and fruit

To make a living, Karoline owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members.  Karoline has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 350 Tala WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Karoline joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Karoline is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD.    Karoline is now requesting a new loan of 1000 Tala WST which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide services. Karoline plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide services

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia I. is a 38 year-old woman living in the town of Samatau 3.  She is married and does not have any chlidren.  To make a living, Malia owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling baked goods in the local community.  Malia has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 200 Tala WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Malia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Malia is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD.  Malia is now requesting a new loan of 1000 Tala WST which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business.    Malia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business

loans.name: Cristo La Fuente 4&5 Group

texts.en:
Nereyda is the group coordinator of the group Cristo La Fuente (Christ is the source) which is based in a rural batey surrounding La Romana. A batey is a rural community nestled in the expansive sugarcane fields that surround La Romana, where the cane cutters, whom are largely of Haitian origin, resiD.. Here she makes her home with her husband and three children in a home provided by the Sugar Company maD. of cement but lacking in electricity. 

Nereyda came to Esperanza for the opportunity to inject capital into her business. She is on her second loan cycle after having completed her first loan cycle. She plans to use this loan to purchase 10 dozen pairs of panties and 14 brassieres to sell in her community. She believes that there is ample market to make these sales and this increased quantity will improve her income, which is the primary source of revenue for her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase lady's undergarments to sell

loans.name: Yungueñitas Group

texts.es:
Irene Calderón  de 48 años es casada y tiene tres hijos,  uno de ellos es casado  y ella se encarga de cuidar a sus nietos por la mañana ya que por la tarde Irene vende tucumanas en un carrito en San Francisco, hace 17 años y con ese negocio ha podido sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, actualmente necesita del préstamo para comprar harina, insumo con el cual prepara sus tucumanas.
Las demás integrantes de grupo también tienen sus propios negocios  como la venta de calzados, refrescos, ropa, atención de tienda de barrio, tejido de mantas y venta de comida y todas necesitan del préstamo para comprar mercadería, materia prima y seguir operando en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Irene C. is 48 years old and she has three children. One of her children is married, and she takes care of her grandchildren in the mornings. In the afternoons Irene sells samosas from a cart in San Francisco. She has been selling for 17 years and it is with this business that she has been able to support her children. She requires the loan to purchase flour, an ingredient she uses to prepare her samosas.

The other members fo the group also have their own businesses, including shoe sales, soft drinks, clothing, local shop manager, crocheting and catering,, and they all need a loan to purchase more merchandise and ingredients to keep their businesses running.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and ingredients.

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es:
El señor Isaías L.  ha ido mejorando su casa con ahorros propios, el con  lo poco que gana le va haciendo mejoras a su casa para el bienestar de su familia. Pero ahora el se ve en la necesidad de  construir  una barda en la parte trasera de su vivienda. Donde el vive es una avenida muy transitada aunque el puso alrededor tablas, no es tan seguro como una barda de block.
Sus hijos están pequeños y quiere darles lo mejor en protección para evitar un accidente y mas que todo cuando el sale a trabajar a la maquiladora, la seguridad de sus pertenencias que nadie pueda robar.

loans.use: Construccion de barda

loans.name: David 3 Group

texts.en:
Charlot is the coordinator of the group David which is based in a Batey in the area surrounding L. Romana. A batey is a rural community located amongst the vast sugarcane fields outsiD. of L. Ramona, and the inhabitants, largely of Haitian origin work in cutting sugarcane in the blistering Caribbean sun. Here she makes her home among her fellow Hatian immigrants who work in the Batey.

Charlot came to Esperanza 6 months ago, Charlot has completed here first loan cycle without incident and is now requesting her second loan. With this new loan she intends to purchase a dozen pairs of men's pants, 6 pairs of womens pants, two dozen blouses and a half a dozen perfumes which she will sell in her community. Her dream is to use the profits from this business to finish building her home and to travel to Haiti regularly to see family and to purchase merchandise for cheaper in Haiti.

loans.use: Pants, blouses and perfumes

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a member of The Dawn village bank. 
She is 37 years old and lives with her partner. She has three children who are 13, 7, and 10 months old. Her two eldest are studying at the public school. 
For three years, Sonia has spent every Sunday selling tamales and every weekday afternoon selling picarones (Peruvian dessert). 
Since joining FINCA Perú, Sonia has learned to save and when there are tough economic situations, her business helps cover the expenses of her family. 
Sonia needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy ingredients to make tamales such as corn, banana leaves, oil, and flour. Her dream is to own a place where she can start a convenience store business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make tamales such as corn, banana leaves, oil, and flour.

loans.name: Moacyr

texts.es: Moacyr tiene 35 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos por quienes trata de trabajar arduamente para brindarles las mejores condiciones de vida. Desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar en varias actividades, ya que su familia no tuvo las posibilidades económicas para brindarle estudios superiores. Sin embargo, aprendió a manejar y esa fue la forma que usó para ganar dinero y solventar sus gastos, pero no le desagrada su trabajo, al contrario, por eso brinda sus servicios con mucho humor. Gracias a este esfuerzo logró ahorrar y adquirir su propio motocarro, con el cual realiza transporte de pasajeros. Esta actividad la viene realizando formalmente desde hace 8 años y desde entonces se levanta muy temprano, pues considera que la mayor demanda es por las mañanas, cuando todas las personas salen rumbo a sus trabajos y estudios. Los 29 préstamos que tiene Moacyr en Microfinanzas PRISMA son reflejo del trabajo y esmero que muestra como miembro del banco comunal donde trabaja en base a la responsabilidad. Los 1000 soles que ahora solicita le permitirán reparar su motocarro, el cual requiere de un mantenimiento general para evitar perdidas con el tiempo.
texts.en:
Moacyr is 35 years old, married, and has 2 children for whom he works arduously in order to provide them with a better quality of life. Since he was very young he learned to work on various activities, because his family did not have the economic resources to provide him with a superior education. Nevertheless, he learned to drive and this was the manner in which he earned money and covered his expenses. He doesn't dislike working, on the contrary, he enjoys his work and because of this he is able to provide his services with good humor.

Thanks to his efforts he succeeded in saving and acquiring his own motorcar (light 3-wheeled vehicle), with which he is able to transport passengers. He has been doing this activity formally for 8 years. He rises early, considering that the majority of demand is for the mornings when people are leaving for work or school. The 29 loans that Moacyr has had from Microfinanzas PRISMA are reflected in the work and care that he demonstrates as a member of a communal bank where work forms the basis of responsibility. The 1000 soles that he now requests will permit him to repair his motorcar, which requires general maintenance to avoid losses over time.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintenance of his motorcar

loans.name: Otila

texts.en:
Otila S. is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Seesee. She is married and has three adult children. Otila owns and operates a food stall selling baked goods in the local community. Otila has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 650 Tala WST a month.

In 2007, Otila joined Kiva partner SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Otila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business. Otila is now requesting a loan of 2500 Tala WST which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product range. The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Otila from SPBD. Otila plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product range

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa O. est une femme âgée de 51 ans mariée avec 4 enfants. Elle habite à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle fait la commercialisation des céréales. D’après ses expériences en stockage elle avait réalisé qu’il y a beaucoup de bénéfices dans le stockage. Donc avec ce crédit elle voudrait multiplier ses stocks de mais et voudrait ajouter le stock de piment. Avec ce prêt également elle voudrait ajouter la vente des produits de consommation crue. Elle vise utiliser ses profits dans sa propre santé, la scolarisation de ses enfants et plus tard construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Yawa O. is a 51-year-old woman and is married with 4 children. She lives in Adéta, a town located approximately 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She works in the distribution of grain. Her experience in grain storage has helped her realize that storage is a profitable area. Therefore, with the requested loan, she would like to increase her corn stock, as well as add pepper stock. With this loan, she would also like to start selling products for raw consumption. She is planning to use the generated profits to improve her own health, to school her children and to build her own house.

Translated from French by Dina Dumenko, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Corn and Pepper Storage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Soybean

loans.name: Zrou

texts.fr: Zrou D. est un mécanicien âgé de 31 ans marié avec un enfant. Il habite et travaille à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Il a réalisé qu’il obtiendrait plus de bénéfices s’il associait la vente de pièce d’occasion des voitures à son atelier. Avec ce prêt il souhaiterait aussi acheter les outils de travail afin de recruter beaucoup d’apprentis qui obtiendront à la fin de leur apprentissage une prestation de service. Avec ses bénéfices, il pense construire un garage mécanique et assurer d’une meilleure manière la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Zrou D., age 31, is a mechanic who is married and has one child.  He lives and works in Adéta, a town located about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo.  He realized he would have bigger profits if he added the sale of used car parts to his shop.  With this loan, he would also like to buy work tools in order to recruit many apprentices, who will actively serve at the end of their apprenticeship.  With his profits, he thinks he will build a mechanic's garage and will better ensure that his children are educated.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Jorge Luis Celso

texts.es:
Jorge Luis tiene 28 años de edad, es casado, y vive junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo de cuatro meses de nacido en la casa de sus padres que está ubicada en el distrito de Ciudad Eten, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años se dedica al trasporte de carga y pasajeros en su mototaxi (vehículo motorizado de tres ruedas) durante todo el día trabaja en su vehículo y con lo recaudado sustenta los gastos económicos de su hogar.

El continuo uso ha hecho que el vehículo sufra algunos desperfectos en el motor, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el arreglo y mantenimiento de su instrumento de trabajo.

Su más grande anhelo es comprarse un terreno y construir allí una casa en la que pueda vivir junto a su familia; sus vecinos lo consideran como un joven alegre y responsable que todos los dias trabaja arduamente para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 28, married, and lives with his wife and four-month son in his parents' house, which is located in the district of Ciudad Eten, twenty-minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For two years he has transported cargo and passengers in his moto taxi (a three-wheeled motorized vehicle). He works all day on his vehicle and with the money he gains he supports the costs of his household. The continual use of the vehicle has caused some damage to the engine. For this reason, Jorge Luis finds him himself asking our institution for his first loan of 1200 soles to invest in the repair and maintenance of his means of work. His greatest desire is to buy a piece of land and to build a house there so he can live together with his family. His neighbors consider him a happy and responsible young man who works arduously every day to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair and maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: approvisionnement en gros de sucre,lait,tomate,frommage,savon etc....

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a freezer

loans.name: Eugenia Angélica

texts.es:
Eugenia tiene 43 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 18 y 14 años de edad en el Sector Urrunaga, distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado a 5 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lleva 20 años vendiendo comida en un puesto del mercado Carolina (mercado de la zona) donde atiende todos los días desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde, debido al tiempo que lleva atendiendo y a su buena sazón, ella se ha vuelto muy conocida en la zona y siempre tiene fieles clientes que vienen a comer a su establecimiento.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de insumos para ofrecer más variedad de platos de comida y ofrecerlos a sus clientes, es por ello que está solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Su más grande sueño es lograr adquirir un terreno y construir en él una casa propia ya que actualmente vive en una alquilada, además desea asegurarle a sus hijos un futuro mejor haciéndoles estudiar una carrera técnica o profesional.

Es la segunda vez que Eugenia trabaja con nosotros, y ha demostrado ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos por lo que es considerada como una buena cliente.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two children,18 and 14 years old. She lives in the Urrunaga section of the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, located five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been selling food at a stand in the Carolina market (a market in the area) for 20 years, where she goes every day and is there from six in the morning to four o'clock in the afternoon. Due to the length of time that she has been doing this and to her good cooking skills, she has become very well known in the area and always has faithful customers that come to eat at her establishment. She wishes to purchase supplies to grow her business and be able to offer more variety of food to her customers. This is the reason for her request of a loan of 1500 new soles. Her biggest dream is to obtain a piece of land and build her own home as she currently lives in a rented house. Additionally, she would like to assure a better future for her children by enabling them to study for a technical or professional career. This is the second time that Eugenia works with us and she has proven to be responsible and punctual in her payments, which makes her a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for the preparation of food for sale.

loans.name: Ericka Yaneth

texts.es:
La señora Ericka vive con su esposo el señor Javier Armando, al igual que con sus 2 hijos forman una familia muy unida; ella labora para una empresa desde hace 2 años como operadora y su cónyuge trabaja para una fábrica en el área de supervisor con una antigüedad de 2 años también.
Ellos son una familia muy responsable y trabajadora que buscan un futuro sólido para sus hijos; están solicitando este crédito para la construcción de una barda en el frente de su vivienda para mayor seguridad de sus hijos y de su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ericka lives with her husband, Mr. Javier Armando; together with their two children they are a very close family. She has been working for a company as an operator for the last two years and her husband works at a factory in the area as a supervisor, also since two years ago. They are a very responsible and hard working family that are working towards a solid future for their children. They are requesting this loan to be able to build a high fence in front of their house for better security for their children and their home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a wall in front of their house.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su hijo de 28 años de edad en el centro poblado menor Villa el Sol, distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado a 5 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 20 años ella tiene una bodega - tienda en la que vende artículos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes y verduras, este negocio ha sido la única fuente de ingreso económico de su hogar durante estos años.

El tiempo durante el cual ha mantenido su negocio le han valido para hacerse conocida entre sus vecinos los que siempre acuden a ella para comprarle sus productos ya que la zona en la que viven está alejada del mercado, su hijo la ayuda todos los días y juntos tratan de salir adelante trabajando con esmero.

Su más grande anhelo es ampliar su negocio e implementar su tienda con mas variedad de artículos, por este motivo ella está solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.

Esta es la tercera vez que Basilia trabaja con nosotros, su responsabilidad y puntualidad la ha hecho ser considerada como una cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Basilia is 45 years old, a single mother, and lives with her 28 year old son in the suburb Villa el Sol, in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, located 5 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last 20 years she has been running a grocery store, where she sells essential items (rice, sugar,oil), groceries and vegetables. This business has been her family's only source of income during these years. In the time that she has had her business, she has become well known among her neighbors who always come to her to buy her products since the area in which they live is far from the market. Her son helps her every day and together they try to get ahead working with care. Her biggest dream is to enlarge her business and set up a store with more variety of items. This is the reason for her request of a loan of 2000 new soles from our institution. She plans to invest the money in the purchase of more products which she can provide to her customers. This is the third time that Basilia works with us. Due to her responsibility and punctuality, she is considered an excellent customer.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products and groceries for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy work supplies and equipment

loans.name: Cecile

texts.fr: Cecile E. est une femme de 31 ans marié et mère de 2 enfants. Il habite à Agadji une ville située à environ 250 kilomètre de Lomé, la capitale du TOGO.  Elle profite de la baisse du prix du mais pour acheter beaucoup et en faire un  stock. Puisqu’elle vend la pate fabriqué à base du mais, alors elle utilisera le stockage quand les prix du mais vont augmenter. En ce moment elle procurera beaucoup de bénéfices. Avec ces bénéfices elle souhaiterait construire un restaurant-bar plus tard.

loans.use: le stock du mais

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es una madre D. familia D. 64 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo, el último D. sus 13 hijos y dos D. sus nietos en el distrito pesquero D. Santa Rosa, ubicado a 25 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Lleva aproximadamente 30 años vendiendo pescado seco – salado en el Mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo), cada lunes y jueves se levanta temprano para ir al terminal pesquero D. su ciudad a comprar caballa fresca (una variedad D. pescado muy consumido en la región) para procesarla y ofrecerla a sus clientes.

Su esposo se dedicaba anteriormente a la pesca artesanal, pero ahora, debido a su avanzada edad, ya no pueD. trabajar, por este motivo está solicitando a nuestra Institución un préstamo D. 2500 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra D. más pescado para mantener su negocio y D. esa manera seguir apoyando a la economía del hogar.

Uno D. sus más grandes sueños es hacer mejoras en la infraestructura D. su casa, ya que el paso del tiempo y la cercanía al mar han deteriorado algunas paredes D. su hogar.

Ella ya ha trabajado con nosotros en cinco oportunidades y en todas ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos por este motivo es considerada como una cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Andrea is a 64 year old mother who lives together with her husband, the youngest of her thirteen children, and two of her grandchildren in the fishing district of Santa Rosa, located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Andrea has been selling dried, salted fish in the Moshoqueque Market (the principal market of Chiclayo), for about 30 years. Every Monday and Thursday she rises early in the morning to go to the fishing terminal to buy fresh mackerel (a popular variety of fish in the region), which she later processes and sells to her clients.

Her husband previously worked as a traditional fisherman, but now, due to his age, he can no longer work. For this reason she has asked our institution for a loan of 2500 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of more fish in order to keep her business going and in this way continue to proviD. for household costs.

One of Andrea's biggest dreams is to improve the condition of her home, as time and the proximity of the sea have caused damaged to some of the walls.

She has worked with us on five occasions and each time showed responsibility and punctuality in turning in the payments, making her an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fresh fish to process and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy gasoline and motor oil in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish, sugar, flour, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat des épices en gros

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi A. est un homme de 30 ans marié et père de deux enfants. Il  habite à Kpadape un village situé à 10 kilomètres de kpalimé. Avec ce prêt, koffi voulait acheter du  sucre, du citron, bissape, ananas etc… pour en faire des boissons non alcoolisées. Avec les bénéfices qu’il obtiendra, Koffi rêve de tenir une grande boutique à Lomé pour vendre du poisson.
texts.en:
Koffi A. is 30 years old, married and father of two children. He lives in Kpadape, a village situated 10 kilometres from Kpalimé. With this loan, Koffi would like to buy sugar, lemons, hibiscus, pineapples etc. with which to make non-alcoholic drinks. With the income he will earn, Koffi dreams of having a large shop in Lomé from where he can sell fish.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, lemons, hibiscus, pineapples etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: build some shelves

loans.name: Suititi

texts.en:
Suititi T. is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Maagiagi. She is married and has seven adult children. Suititi owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting decorative plants for sale. Suititi has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 500 WST a month.

Suititi joined Kiva partner SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Suititi has successfully repaid a previous loan from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Suititi is now requesting a loan of 1200 WST which will be used for the same purpose. The loan will be her third loan from SPBD. Suititi plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Faasao

texts.en:
Faasao T. is a 31 year-old woman living in the town of Mulifanua Fou. She is married and has six school-aged children. Faasao owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Faasao has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 350 tala WST a month.

In 2009, Faasao joined Kiva partner SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Faasao's request for a loan of 1000 tala WST, which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment, is her first loan request. Faasao plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza A. is from the village of Becor, Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Eliza is married and has 1 school-aged child. Eliza owns a business operating a "sari-sari" or general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Eliza has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eliza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eliza is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Eliza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Atsu

texts.fr: Atsu A. est un homme de 49 ans  marié et père d’un enfant. C’est un cultivateur demeurant à WOME, un village situé à environ 112 kilomètres de Kpalimé, Il fait la culture du maïs et du manioc  etc … en vue de revendre à la population. Ces céréales et ces tubercules sont utilisés dans la préparation des aliments stables. Avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV, il souhaite multiplier sa production  pour subvenir aux besoins de la population à la saison prochaine. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Atsu A. is 49 years old, married and father to one child. He lives as a farmer in Wome, a village situated around 112 kilometres from Kpaliné. He grows corn and manioc (cassava), etc which he then sells to the local people. These cereals and tubers are used to prepare food that does not need to be refrigerated. With this first loan from FECECAV, he would like to increase his production to be able to meet the needs of his customers next season. This will allow him to earn more money with which to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Deob

texts.en: Deob L. is a low-income people living in the rural area of Kompong Tom Province, about over 200 km from Phnom Penh Capital, along the street 6. She owns small family house and resides with other family members. Since 2006, she absorbed a basic skill of handicraft making from her nearby neighbor and she employs a skill that she learned to earn a living. She also produces rattan cupboard from her home and she will sell out to her buyers every month when she saves up over 20 sets of rattan. In addition, her husband always buys more wooden furniture from other people and resells to gain extra income. This humble couple has six children; most of whom helps with them in making cupboard. Deob L. will be used her loan to purchase a motorcycle which she uses to supply her investment and to reduce her family’s transportation cost.
